review.reviewBody: Functional and I love the ability for them to grow with my kiddo (the red string).
review.name: Functional, easy for my kid to put on themselves.

review.reviewBody: The is the second time I've purchased these pants. They're worth the cost thanks to the ability to lengthen them and the high quality material, making them last at least 2 years. The outer material is more durable and stays drier than other snow pants we've used. They also wash and dry well.
review.name: Durable and Dry

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my grandaughter to go with matching reversible jacket. Love the fabric and the color is perfect!
review.name: I would buy this jacket again!

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and easy movement. I got this for my nephew to wear to hockey practice.
review.name: I would buy this again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a really great snowsuit. Kept my son warm and dry as he played in the snow. It's made well. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: I will be getting these every year for my children

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great sprig jacket. I bought it for my grandson and he loves it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my 3 yr old grandson, it's perfect for when he goes snow boarding at Beaver Creek, CO.
review.name: Great Garment!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these! Super comfy and cozy! My daughter loved skiing in them!
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The color is a bit lighter than the photo and because of the color, they are quick to look dirty. That said, it's worth it because he's the only one wearing green snow pants at school. This stopped the wrong pants coming home every day. And they do great at staying dry in the wet snow.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for any type of snow! It kept my kids so warm during the negative degree weather that they complained of being too hot! Would definitely buy again!
review.name: I would definitely buy this item again if needed!

hasVariant.name: Tungsten Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

hasVariant.name: Tungsten Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Tungsten Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent because, with 2 adults and 2 dogs, the 2-person backpacking tent was getting a little tight. I like all that it comes with for the weight and price. I also love that it's bright and easy to see. Set up was very easy since everything is color-coordinated. The rainfly snaps were a nice touch and will be great when setting up in the dark after a night hike. Another awesome feature is that the tent itself is almost entirely mesh. If you're not in a campground, the open concept would be great for stargazing in the summer but without the rainfly, there isn't a lot of privacy so I would keep it on if you're in a campground.
review.name: Super easy set up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Set it up in the back yard with sons just so its not the first time when we are in the woods.  It was pretty easy and seems to be a quality tent.  Hopefully it will last through years of backpacking/camping with my boys.
review.name: Nice Tent, Easy setup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used the Tungsten 4-Person Tent on a 03-07 OCT BWCA trip, and it performed extremely well for three male adventurers and all our gear. The tent provided plenty of space, and it kept us dry and comfortable, even in colder conditions. Setup was quick and easy, and the durability of the materials was clear. The tent handled the wind and elements without any issues. Highly recommend for anyone needing a reliable and spacious tent for outdoor adventures!
review.name: Perfect Tent for Fall BWCA Adventures

review.reviewBody: I've only had this tent for a summer so I can't speak to its longevity, but this tent has been through rain and wind storms this summer and has held up incredibly well. I lay in it with gusts whipping outside that almost completely flattened the tent sideways, and it stayed staked and strong. Love this tent and hope to have it for many seasons to come.
review.name: Best Tent I've Ever Had

review.reviewBody:
Have used this 4p version a handful of times this summer ranging from the rain to 90* nights and has preformed wonderfully. Very easy to set up. Poles feel strong, fabric well sewn. Rain fly works great, well places vents and tie outs keep it ventilated. The two vestibules are extremely useful on rainy days, just wish the footprint (which is included with purchase - nice!) extended to cover at least one vestibule. The tent itself is almost all mesh and made for a great no rain fly stargazing night. 

Wish they sold a mesh top shelf, it has the hooks for it.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very high quality product. On our first night out it rained the entire night. Woke up to the tent completely dry. Very pleased with this product.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: My scout troop decided on Marmot’s in 2015, and we’ve been very satisfied.  We mostly have Tungsten 3’s (comfortable for 2), and recently we’ve diversified to 4’s (for 3 scouts) as well as 2’s (for 1 scout).  Solid all around.
review.name: Tungsten’s very solid

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It was a gift for my son.  He took it camping at Big Bend, where it withstood the rain and wind, and kept him dry!
review.name: Great Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best tent out there for a reasonable price tag. Best thing isn’t can get it deployed in 5 minutes
review.name: Solid tent overall

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very lightweight tent. I actually got the 4p but overall I really like this tent. Lots of mesh for stat gazing.
review.name: Great tent

name: Tungsten Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.itemreviewed: Summit AmFib Lite Mountain Bike Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The cut is simply wrong for cycling.  Pearl Izumi is my go-to brand for cycling attire, and their tights alway fit me perfectly. So I assumed they'd get this one right too. The pants are too short, the hips are too baggy, and the crotch area is too loose. When returning to a seated position, the pants catch your saddle, unless you pull them up high, but that then exposes your ankles.  The ankle cuffs, despite their beefiness, are quite loose as well. Was hoping these would be a good snow biking pant, but they just don't work.

I'll say they "run small", in terms of length, but they "run large" in terms of width and bagginess.
review.name: Pearl Izumi got this one wrong

name: Summit AmFib Lite Mountain Bike Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The coat is simply the best - warm, thin, light and waterproof.
review.name: The best!

review.reviewBody: It is very nice and warm, but needs inside pockets. More pockets.
review.name: More pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Extremely warm and comfortable. Just wish marmot produced petit sizing. But I bought anyway.
review.name: Petit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this coat! I work at a college and spend a good part of my day walking around campus so having a warm winter coat is a priority. I purchased it in Hazy Purple and have gotten a ton of compliments on the color and on the coat in general.
review.name: Love this coat 💕

review.reviewBody: very comfortable and warm. love the red color. size fits as expected.
review.name: Women's Chelsea Coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is super warm! It was 0 degrees in Michigan and I was warm with just asweater underneath!! I was cold with my old one. The only thing I don't like is the collar, it's quite stiff and it keeps rubbing my chin. I wished I ordered a bigger size.
review.name: Impressed!

review.reviewBody: I'm a size 8 and purchased a L to make sure I had room for layers. Kept me warm getting to and from work in recent -30 F wind chill. Has a double zipper to make it easier to sit down or walk longer distances, the hood fits nicely and stays up, and the cuffs have fleece to seal up the sleeves. It's puffy and almost knee-length without feeling too bulky.
review.name: Warm and weatherproof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is warm, well made and comfortable. It fits great. I am a size 14 and there is room for layers.
review.name: love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is bomb proof for cold windy rainy winters.  Love the bright color.  We've been having a slew of cold windy rainy winter weather and this jacket has been great.  Rain beads off.  I stay nice and warm.  The only quibble I have is the fit of the jacket around the neck.  It's not as tight as I would like.  You'll need a neck gaiter or scarf to be perfectly cocooned.
review.name: Great Winter Jacket for Windy Wet Weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Found the perfect heavy jacket for northeast winters. The olive green color is neutral and great. I like the zipper it feels secure. The hood fits nicely and comfortable. I like the tailored look of the jacket too. Flattering cut.
review.name: Warmest jacket ever!

name: Chelsea Down Coat - Women's

description: Buy the Shimano BT-DN110-A Di2 Battery online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BT-DN110-A Di2 Battery
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano BT-DN110-A Di2 Battery online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Started happening that my battery would be dead at the start of a ride. I thought it might have been laying against the shifter, but it happened three times. Time for a new battery and that solved the problem. Plug and play and it holds a charge like when it was new. Only 6 years old and 15,000 miles but it was this battery’s time.
review.name: No more dead battery at the ride start

review.reviewBody: After 7 years it was time to repalce my battery.  Shipping was fast.   The BT-DN100-A also provided the upgrade to allow me to add the wireless module as well.  All was seamless.
review.name: Easy swap-out and upgrade

review.reviewBody: On my road bike, I have a Shimano Alfine internal gear hub, 11 speed for a 1 x 11 setup. I got the Di2 motorized shifter for it and use this battery to do the shifting. After some rides around my home for most of a summer, I rode this bike along the Pacific Coast from Canada to Mexico in the fall of 2019, immediately pre-covid. The shifting and charging were flawless. Indicator lighting works properly, and only once did I run out of juice so was locked into a gear with no means to change it. I'm thinking about 7 to 10 thousand shifts per charge. I have a front dynamo hub and was able to charge the Di2 battery while riding for the rest of the day and all worked out just fine. Good system, Shimano.
review.name: Works really well on the long haul

review.reviewBody:
I finally got my bike built and plugged in the battery and to my surprise my brand new Di2 system is DEAD! Shouldn't there be at least SOME charge in a brand new battery??
 I hope it's only a charge issue and this battery isn't a dud!!!
review.name: Battery Is DEAD!

name: BT-DN110-A Di2 Battery

hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi Transfer Air 7in Sock - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have a lot of socks and these Transfer air 7in are quickly becoming one of my first to grab from the drawer. They are awesome on hot days. Solid compression, but not so much that they become uncomfortable after a few hours. They are thin but not see-through. I've worn the 7inch transfer air socks in 90 degrees and had no regrets which is usually not the case on a tall sock for me. 

An added plus is there's no cushion, as I usually don't feel the need for the extra bulk.
review.name: One of the lightest I've used.

name: Transfer Air 7in Sock - Men's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Mesh 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mesh 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Mesh 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] High quality, great size. Stands up to abuse. Great way to organize must haves while packing gear. Would buy again
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am really thrilled with my new Mesh Stuff Sack Set!  The three different sizes and color coding makes it easy to pick the one most suitable for my needs.  I like the fact that the mesh is breathable so a wet bathing suit and towel will be able to dry on the go!
review.name: Works Great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These were perfect for summer camp for my kids. They used these for their wet clothes. The mesh material made it so there was no odors from the wetness. There is 3 sizes big, medium and small. They are lightweight and easy to use.
review.name: Great for camp

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These 3 sizes of Sea to Summit mesh bags are great for all different occasions. They are lightweight yet very durable. Having 3 sizes is great, can use for various purposes. They can get wet and they dry pretty fast.
review.name: Can use for many things

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These mesh sacks work well and are good material. I can store socks in them so they don't get lost along with other things. It's mesh so the items don't soak up moisture. I just honestly thought the bags were going to be a little bigger but they work just fine.
review.name: Work well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These bags do fit a lot of stuff and compress really nicely. The bit that I'm a little iffy on is the plastic cinch piece. It seems like it is slightly less durable and would break much easier. However, I like these bags a lot.
review.name: Fits a lot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love these bags. The mesg bags are very durable, and make taking things with you when your camping much easier. The 3 different sizes is an added plus, and the drawstring to close the bags makes it really easy to secure your items.
review.name: Great bags

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have no issues with these mesh storage bags. We are sending them to camp with my daughter and I’m sure they’ll be out to good use. They are obviously high quality - you can tell by the stitching and thickness of the material. 

They’re smaller than I thought they would be, but that’s my own fault for not looking at the sizes.
review.name: Work well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These mesh stuff sack set from Sea to summit are a must have for every trip. Comes in a pack of 3 different sizes. Holds wet items with ease, no dripping or anything! Throw them in the washer and your done. Durable and is flexible to fit a lot of items in them. Highly recommend.
review.name: A must have!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These stuff sacks make it quick and easy to identify the contents and get what you are looking for rather than open and dig through a sack only to find that you stashed the item in another sack.They are tough and resilient, but probably not as durable as the standard sack, and prone to catch on rough surfaces or protruding objects. They are a little pricey, but a nice functional and convenient addition to my pack. If, like me, you sometimes forget where you stuffed your stuff, these are a handy piece of gear.
review.name: Very Handy and Convenient

name: Mesh 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set

review.reviewBody: I got these in the pink color and wore it riding for about 90 minutes (PNW) and it was raining a little, so the trails were wet. The back of the shorts was covered in mud / dirt. Got home and hosed it off and went into the wash. The back of the shorts still had mud stains on it. Exchanging for a new pair, but def more of dry weather riding shorts. Material is amazing, soft and great strech.

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: This is the second purchase of this item. I have the original and needed a second one for a new bike. I wouldnt ride without it. It works well with my Wahoo ROAM and BOLT.
review.name: Safety first

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: This is my second one, it’s great
review.name: Excelente product

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody:
Paired with Garmin 530 Edge. Don't know how I lived w/o it. All at a very reasonable price (it was on sale)
Only regret, should of purchased earlier
review.name: Amazing radar tail light combo

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: After just a few rides, this has proven itself as a must-have to anyone who rides on the road.  It works EXACTLY as described.  Easy to us, easy to hear, easy to pair to the Garmin Edge 800.
review.name: Game Changer!

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: It iş bey useful especially when you’re riding alone and dark
review.name: Radar backlight

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: Anytime I was in a group ride I benefited from the people around me with these. I am glad I finally picked up my own. First couple rides and I am annoyed I waited so long. Paired quickly to my Edge 820 and off and running.
review.name: Shouldn't have waited

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: I have been riding on the roads for a long time, now having  the Varia alert me to cars and bikes coming up behind me is awesome. Wish I purchased this earlier!
review.name: Extremely helpful!

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: I have used this for a couple and so rides already and I am very happy with it.  Everything I have read about before buying this has been true and accurate.  I was worried a bit that during group rides, the bike behind you would trigger an alert, but as engineered, it will not recognize cyclists behind you running at the same speed.  What's more, even with several cyclists right behind you, when it detects a car entering the threshold, the alert goes off.  Simply an amazing technology and product and it beats trying to look back if it is safe to change lanes due to no incoming traffic.  I only wished that I got the version with the camera with it.  Better than Trek CarBack in a sense that Trek's version claims it can detect vehicles at a greater distance.  From a video review, Trek is no better than Garmin's.  I guess, CarBack is simply just too new to work it kinks out.  Maybe after a few years when CarBack has reached the maturity of the Varia.  But then again, I don't see the marginal value of having to detect vehicles in a greater distance than 140m.  Time to get a Garmin watch to take advantage of vibration alerts.  I  have just learned an app integration with Apple Watch called ARadar.  Downloaded it and hope it works!
review.name: Simply excellent!

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody: Works as advertised and worth the money. Will not ride on the streets without it.
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight
review.reviewBody:
I had the first varia that came out. It was good, but this one is much improved. I used it recently on a couple week bikepacking trip in Spain. It detects vehicles further back than the earlier version. The beep and visual from my garmin computer gave me a heads up. The battery life is excellent, and most days lasts longer than a person can pedal. 

I really like the device for giving me another piece of data to help avoid cars.
review.name: Works perfectly

name: Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar with Taillight

review.reviewBody: Really impressed with these! Light weight, comfy, good fit, and super durable. I was pretty impressed that I can wear these pants in all seasons.  Work well with pads while still having a good slim profile. I'm 5'9" 155 lbs and the smalls fit perfect.
review.name: Great all season pant

review.reviewBody: These are really nicely put together! The construction is full of details that really show that Endura knows what they are doing. Everything from the zipper garages on the fly and pockets to the lazer perforations at the knee, to the articlulation of the knees and waist adjustment gives the feel of a well-thought-out, top-end piece of kit. The contouring of the pants as a whole, not just the knees, really feel perfect when in the riding position and the four way stretch feel great. The fabric definitely feels light, but at the same time it doesn't feel fragile or delictate. I expect these to hold up to some reasonable punishment. For now, I just love the fit and the included details on the pants. I'm looking forward to getting some serious ride time in them and I can hopefully update my review then!
review.name: Light and Airy!

review.reviewBody: Pants are great and what I expected as I check them on the Endura site. But not the correct images on here.
review.name: Wrong Image for pants

name: MT500 Burner Lite Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The outseam measures about 16.5", not 18." As a tall, long-legged, skinny person, these are way too short to just wear around.  I'll still use these for swimming, but they're far shorter than a walk short should be--and far shorter than advertised. 

These also have a weird fly/closure system...a zipper fly, an ineffectually tiny piece of velcro, and then a standard boardshort drawstring on top of that. There's a lot going on and it doesn't quite work.
review.name: Very very short

name: Wavefarer Hybrid 18in Walk Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was packing for a bikepacking trip tonight and one of the orange closure straps broke. Glad it was at the house. review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My partner loves his osprey bag as his everyday commute bag on his bike. Lots of spaces and plenty of pocket. The strap to hang his helmet is definitely a plus.
review.name: My partner loves his osprey

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pack. I've fit clothes, toiletries, a book, headphones, fly rod/reel/fly box, and more in it to get me through a week long trip with no issues (gotta back it tight tho). Haven't used it for biking or commuting yet but it's definitely built right for that use case. If you're looking for a solid multi purpose pack - look no further. 

The only minor downside to this pack is that the bottle holders are not designed in a way to fit larger bottles like my 40oz hydroflask. But that's really just an inconvenience more than anything.
review.name: Great pack. I've fit clothes,

review.reviewBody: I’m 6’4” and about 195 lbs with 36” arm length and a size large fits me well. I could use another inch in the arms if I was being picky but the arm length is sufficient. I wore this jacket twice so far on stormy snowy days with wind at about 25 degrees and it worked well. I bought this jacket for in bounds skiing on cold/stormy days and I think it’s perfect. I will not be hiking with this jacket since it’s just too big for that. The hood is nice and large and fits over my helmet just fine. I love this jacket and I highly recommend it.
review.name: Excellent in-bounds super warm

review.reviewBody:
Bought it for northeast winters which are windy and wet
Very warm
Great weather protection
Looks great
I’m 6’3”, 200lb and a L is perfect
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: 5 11, 190ish. Size L. Fit is great. Does not bind in arms, room for layering, yet not baggy. Description does not have all the pockets. 2 zip hand, 2 zip chest, (not foolishly on the same side), 1 zip arm, One side internal drop in. Arm vents. What the confused young gentleman with "lots of coats" in the previous review means to say is that he thinks the weight, or amount of insulation in the coat is not enough, (the 700 fill number has nothing to do with this). Is he right? Mmm, no. For this style of coat it is about perfect, and certainly not skimpy. You may disregard remarks about "mesh" as well. My only peve is that I did not realize it had a powder skirt. These were never a good idea, just preference. It snaps out of the way and is not even an issue. Balsam color is very slightly lighter than on screen. Recommended.
review.name: Nice job

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. It'll be great for running around town or hitting the slopes.
review.name: Such a big comf!

review.reviewBody: Solid construction and fits well! The jacket is warm and comphy to wear. Also has good length in the arms which is nice when other brands seem to think everyone has weirdly short arms.
review.name: I highly recommend this jacket for taller folks!

review.reviewBody: It's really nice but the fit is puffy
review.name: Puffy but warm

review.reviewBody: Most down jackets are not waterproof and you end up needing another layer. specially in the pacific Northwest. This jacket is the solution to that. Warm and comfortable. Good zippers, pockets and ventilation.
review.name: Awesome waterproof down jacket

review.reviewBody: I got this new jacket right in the midst of a good ol upper Midwest cold snap that had windchills down to -22f. This jacket made doing chores way more bearable than my old drafty coat. Love it so far, my wife likes to steal it though.
review.name: Made the -20f cold snap bearable

review.reviewBody: It seems like it'll be a warm coat for skiing. I've had good luck with other OR gear, and their customer service has always been good for me.
review.name: Haven't tested it out on the mountain yet, but fits well

review.reviewBody: Use at work and general outdoor activities in winter. Very warm and comfortable. Cuffs at the wrist and waist keep drafts out.
review.name: Great jacket.

review.reviewBody:
Great fit and so comfortable!  
These do a great job keeping me dry and warm while allowing me to move about freely.
review.name: Cirque III Pants for the Win!

review.reviewBody: I own a little gardening business and bought these pants for working outdoors in cold rain and winter conditions.  They are very comfortable, I love the waist closure button and belt and all the pockets.  I have only worn them once so far, but they shed rain well, have good stretch/ movement, and look good too.  I wear a size 6 in the Ferrossi pants ( my fave pants for outdoor summer work), my waist is 29";   I wasn't sure if I should order a small or medium since I am on the cusp,  but happy that I ordered the S,  there is still room for a thick base layer underneath.  I definitely recommend these and wish they came in Hunter green so I could talk myself into needing second pair.
review.name: I never write reviews but.....

review.reviewBody: I like the Rab items I have so I decided to try this jacket.  It is a mix of warming down and also heat-releasing, cooling stretch knit.  I often wear down vests and this is sort of like that when you are in cold temperatures because the sense of cold air being able to hit your arms is significant and noticeable.  Maybe a vest is more practical.  The arms taper and are extra fitted at the wrist, so you cannot push them up if you get warm while exercising.  Underarm perspiration does not entirely escape so the fabric there can become a little moist.   Perhaps this jacket will be at its best in temperatures which are cool but not frigid.  Nice quality materials.  Good appearance.
review.name: Interesting mixed fabrics

review.reviewBody: I purchased this jacket recently for a trip to Germany and Austria in early October and it was the perfect jacket. Not too heavy and yet warm and comfortable for weather varying between the high 50s to mid 70s. It’s great for those days that do not require a heavy puffy, I highly recommend, especially for the price.
review.name: Great micro light jacket

review.reviewBody:
Washed as instructed, Rab logo and printed labels come off after one wash or peeling. Down moves leaving flat not insulated areas.
Has to be washed after every hike as it holds the smell of sweat.
review.name: Overpriced rubbish

review.reviewBody:
Came quickly after ordering online. 

Absolutely love it. Lovely colour (deep heather). Fits well as an extra layer for spring/summer/autumn wear. It is fitting so unlikely to wear it for winter use as an outer jacket but would work well as a mid-layer. Packs down into a pocket which is handy for the rucksack. No complaints with it.
review.name: Came quickly after ordering online.

review.reviewBody: The jacket is fabulous! Sadly it has a faulty outer pocket but I bought it to go away with so cannot return it as yet
review.name: The jacket is fabulous! Sadly

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love it - fit slightly small so went up a size from what I normally buy. Normally a 12 which was snug round hips so got 14. Love how you can fold it small and take with you. Very warm. Not a waterproof but great for warmth underneath one
review.name: Absolutely love it - fit

review.reviewBody: I love the fit, the jacket is light weight and packs up small but yet is warm enough to provide a vital, insulating extra layer for when the weather turns unexpectedly cooler or windier when on the fells. It is the addition to my outdoor wardrobe that I was previously missing!
review.name: I love the fit, the

review.reviewBody: Lovely lightweight warm jacket. Bought this for playing tennis matches on chilly evenings and it’s perfect
review.name: Lovely lightweight warm jacket. Bought

review.reviewBody:
Lovely and light weight with a perfect fit - it’s my second Rab coat and my first one is now 7 years old and still going strong 
Highly recommended 
Also impressed it arrived in a recyclable bag and not wrapped in plastic
review.name: Lovely and light weight with

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket and love that it fits into its own pocket - great light weight warm layer and it doesn't matter if it gets wet!

review.reviewBody: My primary sport is running so I do a lot of my strength training in the evenings. I love this pre-workout because it works, despite not having the caffeine. (Note: I have not tried the caffeinated versions so this is only relevant to the caffeine-free.) It provides a little pick-me-up after the work day and gives just enough motivation to start lifting. Once the blood is flowing everything feels great and I don't crash afterward. The flavor is great, I wish they had more variety in the caffeine-free option.
review.name: Great for Evening Lifters

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable and fitting on palm of hand but i found the fingers a little longer than expected. something I have never experienced before in gloves.  So fingers run long for a large?
review.name: Nice feel fingers run a little long for

review.reviewBody: Bought these gloves less than a week ago and they are already splitting along one seam - poor manufacturing.
review.name: Breaking down after less than a week…

review.reviewBody: Kept hands warm in 15-25 degree temperatures for hours. High quality,comfortable, durable, breathable material.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody:
I feel like my hands are of normal proportions, but the gloves fit tonight around palms, but too long in the fingers. Maybe just me issue.

I was also looking for something a little warmer than just simple cotton gloves, but not as bulky as snow gloves. These are kind of neither. A lot more bulk, but not really any warmer. 

They’re okay. Look good though
review.name: Strange fit, not that warm for the bulk

review.reviewBody: Definitely toasty with a nice grip.  I actually got the gloves to use after winter paddling for loading my surf ski or sup onto the car. After paddles, I'm usually wet and a tad cold so the gloves have helped with keeping my fingers warm and flexible without losing grip of my gear.
review.name: Definitely Toasty

review.reviewBody: I like these alot very high quality and warm.Sensor tips work well with cell phone.
review.name: Good sensor gloves.

review.reviewBody: I really like this, quite stylish and love how they can be attached together.Only thing I found odd as noted by others was how the fingers appear to be very long but its not a deal breaker still fits well.Have not used it for cell phone use yet so dont know how that works but I really like these, they seem pretty warm to for the 30-40 degree weather lately.
review.name: Nice gloves

review.reviewBody: My go-to glove (3 pairs) for winter activities, running, hiking, snowblowing the driveway (paired with a shell glove) and driving. Great fit, durable and washable! Highly recommend!
review.name: Flurry Sensor Gloves

review.reviewBody: These are a bit stronger than typical fleece liners. Probably much better for dealing with fire. The touch fingertip works well. Not very warm, and over-priced even at the sale price. However, even XL's are tight around my palm and ridiculously long in the fingers. I have to return them.
review.name: Long and narrow

review.reviewBody: Same good warmth for casual outdoor activities but fingers seem longer as if making changed compared to two other pairs
review.name: Warm casual activity glove

review.itemreviewed: RX801 Rally Gravel Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The main thing I hate about gravel riding is getting pebbles in my shoe. These do an amazing job at solving that problem while being ultra-light and even airy to boot. As someone with finicky feet, I usually stay away from shoes with only a single BOA, but somehow the lacing pattern of these does a great job of reducing the usual pressure points that single BOA shoes create. My only gripe is that the Orange is more Copper, but oh well. The cleat adjustment range is pretty small compared to a lot of other shoes though, so beware if you're at the extreme ends of your current shoes' adjustment.
review.name: All the right features for gravel

name: RX801 Rally Gravel Bike Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the TRP HY/RD Cable-Actuated Hydraulic Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I upgraded my Co-Motion tandem with these brakes. Installation was easy. Stopping power is a noticeable improvement over the cable only disk brakes. Side note - the tandem has a bracket in the rear that won't allow enough space for the HY/RD caliper so I could only replace the front brake. Even though, being on a tandem with total weight close to 340 lb. it's a huge improvement.
review.name: Improvement over manual disk

name: HY/RD Cable-Actuated Hydraulic Disc Brake

review.reviewBody: These shoes work great! These are my second pair, and I love having my own gear finally!
review.name: Fits perfectly!

review.reviewBody: Our 7 year old boulders regularly and we needed a comfortable climbing shoe. The momentum is a well build beginner climbing shoe she can wear all day and not hurt her feet. Easy to get on and off.
review.name: Kids Momentum Climbing Shoes

review.reviewBody: Shoes seem like they are a good option for kids. My daughter is pleased and climbing well when she wears them. They run small! She wears a sz 13 and we ordered a 2 with plans to wear with socks and hope they will last a year. No way- the 2 is a great fit now but will not last as she grows. Size up!
review.name: Nice shoes, small!

review.reviewBody: Bought for my 6yo, he loves em. Nice and flexible.
review.name: Nice kids shoe

review.reviewBody:
The size 3 shoes were way too small for my size 3 child. Make sure to order a couple sizes up. 
Otherwise great shoes.
review.name: Great shoes, wrong size

review.reviewBody: When it comes to starting to climb, edging and comfort were the most important for me. I bought two pairs for by kids and both love the look, how it fits, and were amazed what a 'climbing' shoe could do on a wall vs just normal shoes. Super happy with this purchase.
review.name: Great Intro Shoe

review.reviewBody: Best kids climbing shoe I have found. I recommend one size up from kids shoe size.
review.name: Best kids climbing shoe I

review.reviewBody: My five-year-old daughter started bouldering a couple weeks ago. Shoes are a great fit and she has not complained about any discomfort. Shoes appear to be the exact same as the adult version. Provides great support at our bouldering gym
review.name: great shoes for first time climber

review.reviewBody: Got the smallest size available. They fit my girl that just turned two well and should last a year or so of growth. Added some confidence for sure. She loves them.
review.name: Small size fits toddler

review.reviewBody: My niece is so excited every time she puts these shoes on. We did buy them slightly large so she can grow in, but I don't expect someone with these shoes to be climbing something hard enough that they need super tight shoes 😂 but they definitely help her climb better anyways!
review.name: Cute and functional

name: Momentum Climbing Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody: I've owned another pair of these shorts for a few years and I LOVE THEM - they are a great length for not riding up and showing thigh, super stretchy, and the buckle belt makes sure they never fall down while also being easy to open when you have to pee quickly. So I wanted to get a second pair and ordered these new ones, in the same size I had before. The new pair was HUGE in comparison to the old ones, at least an extra 1.5-2" in the waist. They fit my 32-33" waist boyfriend.  Sadly, had to return, because they were too big. Not sure if the smalls would have been better, but worried about too small. I'm going to try contacting Sombrio directly about their sizing.
review.name: Great shorts but this version runs large

name: V'Al 2 Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a warm and comfortable winter coat. I got it to replace an identical one from Marmot that had worn out after several years. This design is a little less fitted in the waist than the previous model, and the fake fur collar is a bit stiffer. I am 5'6", 110 lb, and got size small, which allows for layering underneath.
review.name: Excellent winter coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and comfortable! Wore on a 16degree day and was very cozy. Went with this coat because I’m 5’2” - just the right length, love the fleece lining. Bought a large because Marmot tends to run a little small, medium might have fit but large leaves enough room for a sweater.
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, price does not mean quality. I bought this jacket after reading good online reviews and EVERYTHING AND ANYTHING stains it. I even followed the online directions to clean the jacket and it only gave me NEW stains after. Don’t buy this jacket if you want peace of mind you have a clean coat. If you want to chance it, buy black. The jacket is warm and the pockets are nice, hence why I gave 2 stars. Also, be prepared for feathers everywhere, I read this is normal at first, but 2 months in and they still are everywhere.
review.name: Everything and anything will stain this coat
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our Women's Montreal Coat. 

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us.

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: This coat was so soft and snuggly when zipped up. The chin guard and the end of the sleeves had soft fleecy material and was so comfortable against the skin. It would have definitely kept the cold out.  I’m 5’7” and ordered a size large although normally a medium in tops. It hit mid thigh and is TTS but in most puffy coats, I prefer a large on top because if I wear a heavier sweater, I like it to be less snug.  It would be the perfect coat for very cold weather if not doing strenuous activities. Sadly I returned it since I was looking for a coat to keep warm without being too heavy or overly warm in colder temperatures while brisk walking  and this would have been too warm.
review.name: Warm and cozy coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat fits very nice and the material and color is perfect. It’s exactly what I was looking for while shopping online
review.name: Trendy coat

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Marmot Montreal and its longer sibling (the Montreux coat) are both exceptional. Having had countless winter coats over the years, this is the 'buy-anytime-again-model' for me. I have not found any coat that compares to these when it comes to warmth, weight and flattering fit. I love the comfort, softness and immediate warmth it provides while being flattering and contouring to my body shape. Most competitors coats end up looking like a sleeping bag- this one provides sleeping bag feel and elegant looks. 
The only things I would wish to see in an upgraded version are higher quality faux-fux, a higher quality main zipper and a wider color range. These aspects have not caused any issues for me personally, tough. 
If undecided between the Montreal and Montreal version: I find the Montreal version perfect for driving to work, running errants etc in the Midwest winter. The longer version is great for longer walks, christmas market visits etc. I wore the longer version in very cold Ukrainian winter weather, and in combination with high boots, your legs are fully covered!
I hope this does not get discontinued, I want to repurchase this coat every few years!
review.name: Truely the best coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I actually first bought the Montreal coat about ten years ago! I only recently bought a new one because my dogs, cats, hikes and other outdoor adventures tore it beyond repair. It's perfectly warm and puffy, looks nice, and lasts a LONG time!
review.name: LOVE this Coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and cozy! Love the big hood and flattering baffles. Vetiver is a beautiful gray green but it shows any kind of dirt very easily and i have a dark mark across the front from brushing up against a branch that wont come out which is a bummer. Darker colors would probably be more practical.
review.name: Warm but fabric stains easily

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wonderful coat. Light weight but very warm.  I can't wait for next winter!
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wife loves it!!  Says its the warmest jacket she has ever owned.
review.name: Warm!!

name: Montreal Coat - Women's

review.reviewBody: This wader is my first Simms product and it fit great and for the $ is a fantastic product. The river was cold from snow runoff but kept me pretty comfortable for 3-4 hours before taking a break. Highly recommend
review.name: Great waders!

review.reviewBody: Replaced my 15 year old Cabela's waders with these in April of 2022.  I have used them for 9 days total and just went fishing this past weekend to find out both legs leak at the seam to the boot.  The seam tape is coming loose.  Thought these would be of better quality.
review.name: If you want to replace =your waders every 2 years, these are for you.

review.reviewBody: Waders were great. Used them every day on our trip to NZ. Kept me dry other than when I fell in the river twice. Not Simms fault, I Needed cleats on my boots.
Great fit and smart features
review.name: Best Wader I have owned

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of Simms.  For my height the neoprene  feet are usually too large even with double socks for cold weather, and the girth is bulky.  Took me two tries on the mail ordering, but I am very satisfied in getting a pair to fit without extra bulk.
review.name: The M’s run a bit athletic or snug fit to the sizing chart

review.reviewBody:
Great fitting wader very good quality ????
 I like how breathable it is,
 was fishing in cooler weather but still a lot better than my previous pair of cheap waders! 
Would definitely recommend!????
review.name: Freestone waders

review.reviewBody: they are awesome  able to move around easliy. Very comfortable and warm  Love the blue
review.name: awesome waders

review.reviewBody: Santa brought me a pair of Freestone Stockingfoot waders this year.  They replace a 6 year old Freestone pair that I really liked - they take a beating and fit well.  This is my initial, have-not-been-stream tested review.  The new pair are the newer, revised version with several changes - some good, some not so good for me.  The good: The general fit is good, there is a new internal pocket you don't have to pay for, and a sewn-in nylon loop/strap in the back for hanging and drying.  The not so good: The external pocket appears to no longer be waterproof.   The very bad (for me- other might not agree): The gravel guard changed and they no longer have a hook to attach the guard to the boot.  I'm OK with that part.  But to compensate, the guard is now made of a somewhat stretchy, tight fitting neoprene-like material you pull over the boot.   And I mean very tight fitting, making it a HUGE struggle to pull the waders off my feet and ankles.  Who wants to fight with their waders after a day's fishing?  I considered returning but decided to keep them hoping the guards will stretch out a bit. (I'm 5-10, 200, size 9, and ordered a LS).
review.name: Don't like the new gravel guards

review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of waders. I work in an outdoor store and I had to pass up a lot of opportunities to go steelhead fishing because I didn’t have the proper gear. After selling waders for the last year it was clear that I was going with Simms. The Freestone’s fit my budget while being available in my closest size without going up in model tier. I’m 6’ tall, 220 lbs, wear a 38 waist/ 34 inseam pant, and a size 14 shoe. I went with the regular large 12-13’s. The stocking foot could stand to be ever so slightly longer for me due to being a 14 but the bootie does stretch a little bit and ends up fitting well. The inseam allows for high-stepping and low-crouching. The body allows for a mid-weight jacket or a heavy-weight hoodie. I paired them with the G3 Guide Boots in size 14 and the fit is perfect allowing for mid-weight socks. I haven’t worn them in the water yet but if fit is anything to be desired, I have very high hopes for performance in the field. Overall, I’m pretty happy.
review.name: Time to go fishing!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable waders. I’ve caught a lot of fish in my Freestones! Simms has THE BEST customer service, too! Seriously great company with exceptional products.
review.name: Awesome waders from an awesome company

name: Freestone Stockingfoot Wader - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Easy to wear…it’s been my go-to to run errands and go for walks when the elements are soupy. Supportive yet super soft and cushy. I’m not a runner, but I do walk 40 minutes three times a week. This shoe is becoming one of the favorites in my rotation.
review.name: Don’t hesitate…order this shoe. You’re welcome.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoes are very comfortable and great for arthritis (hallux rigidus). In the beginning I had stability issues on trails, but after several months I adjusted. I only need walking sticks on difficult terrain. They are true to fit. I have narrow feet - D (regular) works for me well. Some reviewers complain of pains etc - I can only say that if one has particular foot problems, one should try them first indoors for a few weeks. I hope NB will come up with a GT version
review.name: Highly recommend

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable fit and for me just the right amount of cushion. Fit is true to size so if your feet are a little wider, pick the wide size option.
review.name: Good for feet

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
First things first:
The Fresh Foam X Trail More v3 are the best shoes I have ever worn.  I've been pain free for the past 2 years and owned 5 or 6 pairs over that time.  This is the second pair that I have bought where the right foot fitted much tighter than the left.  

Everything else is great about this particular pair and the colour is really cool.  The size of the right foot being off is why the rating is not 5 stars.
review.name: Great shoes for heel pain.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Excellent! uniquely soft for good. Along with a very good grip. 
This is my second round with this shoe and model. The first run was in challenging conditions of rough terrain, rain and mud...
They are less effective in the rain and the foot did not stay dry, for that there are probably shoes suitable for the rain
review.name: Excellent!

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have the world's hardest-to-fit feet. In the past six months, I have purchased and returned no fewer than six pairs of hiking shoes/sneakers. Wide width. Orthotic. Light weight. Every brand you can name, some costing over two hundred bucks. Just not comfortable. Then I tried these New Balance in mens' sizing and voila: it's a match. It's like hiking and walking on clouds. I fit my orthotics in them and there is still room for my bunion. I may order a second pair just in case they get altered or discontinued or something, because you never know.
review.name: Finally!

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Midsole too mushy. Feels like my foot pushes through the mush and smacks the hard ground. Very surprising feeling for an ultra-cushioned shoe. The midsole foam needs to have more rebound to protect the foot more. My feet were actually sore after a hike. Not a great design.
review.name: Midsole foam is too mushy.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shoe must have been designed by someone who lives on a flat earth, if this was a road running shoe it might somehow make sense that they removed the center lugs of the heel, but a trail shoe needs as much grip as it can get, especially on the downhill when the heel is most used. This shoe would be almost dangerous for any kind of steep or lose downhill trail due to the split in the heel, as would make it so much easier to roll a heel stepping on a rock. I had the previous v2 model and liked them (although did have some durability issues with the lugs ripping off), so had hoped to like these.
review.name: Removed half the of heel lugs, not for trail runs

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not as I had hoped. Not great heel support.  Looks cool online...Wish it was better than it is.
review.name: Wish it was better...

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent cushion, great recovery shoes.  Will not kill you on price
review.name: Good recovery shoes

name: Fresh Foam x Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Barra ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great lenses but frame is not good for fishing, which is what these were bought for. They look good but are not comfortable. Rubber and frame are separating and cracking after only a few months which was disappointing. Very forward heavy, even with croakies they slide off if you're looking down, which is almost constant while fishing. Better off going with the Guide's or a plastic lens to balance the weight.
review.name: Barra glass lens

review.reviewBody: Love the style and fit of these glasses and how sturdy they are. Unfortunately both lenses have developed lines in the tint coming from the sides. These have stayed in the protective storage bag unless being used so they've been shielded from harm or so I thought.
review.name: Lines in lens tint

review.reviewBody: I'm looking forward to using these new sunglasses for fly fishing. The lens color is a little dark so shadows will be very dark. Overall the product seems durable and high quality. It would be wonderful to have a band for times when the glasses come off, so their not dropped and washed down the river.
review.name: So far, all is good!

review.reviewBody: These glasses have great frame material and VERY large lenses, which make them great for progressive-focus lenses. Smith, unfortunately, negated one of my prescription lens focus specifications, but they gave me a credit (not as much as the glasses) and I had a local optometrist install lenses with the correct focus.
review.name: Nice glasses, great service

review.reviewBody: These glasses are heavier than the normal glass lenses. However, the fit and sun protection are great!
review.name: These glasses are heavier than

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing smiths for decades. I think these ones are my new favorites. The quality is solid and the lenses
are
beautiful!
review.name: I have been wearing smiths

review.reviewBody: Great fit, perfect sun darkness and I love the polarized lenses. Now I can see the fish....
review.name: Great fit, perfect sun darkness

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, well made, attractive but not great for driving - polarizing effects through windows and reflective colors on other car windshields is distracting.
review.name: Well made but optical issues.

review.reviewBody: The second your nose starts sweating, they will slide. Not great for hot days on boats, or wearing them outside when hot. Lenses are great and I believe in their lens tech, just the functionality is not good esp. for the price. I highly recommend Smith Optics to consider making cycling-style frames for fishermen in hotter climates.
review.name: Lenses are great, not good for outdoors in heat

review.reviewBody: Wore these twice, dropped once and they broke. I’m not a tall guy and these broke after they fell off my hat onto an LVP floor. They weren’t slammed on the ground or sat on. They are pretty bulky and have a very small, plastic connection point to the hinge which is where they snapped. This is my 3rd pair of Smith sunglasses and my previous ones took way more abuse both on and off the river.
review.name: Broke after one drop

name: Barra ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
I've used UA products for decades are my underlayment to wear under waders when I hunt waterfowl. I always found them to be a good snug fit. My wife got me a set of the Base 3.0, crew neck top and leggings. The top works great, but the bottoms are like squeezing into low rise underwear. They are warmer than the standard crew top and bottoms, but I'm very unhappy with the cut of the bottoms.
Please consider including a 4XL / 5XL line. Us active  big boys get cold outside too!
review.name: base 3.0 are low-rise leggings?
comment: We're sorry to hear the fit wasn't quite right for you. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with this feedback, as we are always looking for ways to enhance our athlete experience and improve our gear!

review.reviewBody: These pieces aren’t cheap - but they’re well worth the money if you need a warm base layer that isn’t thick and bulky. I like them so much I bought two extra pair, and wear them daily in the NY winters.
review.name: Perfect thermal underwear

review.reviewBody: very comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: Most Excellent. Read a few reviews about shedding??? Not my experience. Do not like fitted clothing for outdoor activities. This is just right. So warm - age 72 and always cold. This kept me warm with only one shirt underneath in 32 degree weather. Best purchase!
review.name: Toasty, Comfey, good fit

review.reviewBody: Great fleece, but the "mushroom" color looked like a light taupe online and is actually pale pink in person and not the look I was going for
review.name: it's pink :(

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my trip to Chile. I love the style and fit. It does have a more boxy fit. It kept me warm and felt cozy. The only negative thing I have to say about this is that it sheds. So be aware.
review.name: Cozy and Soft but sheds..

review.reviewBody: Patagonia, what happened?! This is my third try at a fleece and this one is such a great weight and fit. However, the quality is lacking. Cream colored fleece sheds everywhere, the seatbelt of my car is covered! I find tiny bits all over my pants, shirt, purse and anything that comes into contact with it.
review.name: Perfect mid weight, but sheds!

review.reviewBody:
I had an old fleece from Patagonia that was sort of this style - Marsupial though it didn’t have zippers and it ran particularly small - and I ordered another one, same problem. I wore them plenty, but frankly I was disappointed with them.

Along this Marsupial comes along…I am so in love and will be wearing it all the time! First of all, Patagonia got the sizing right. And I can wear it over a tshirt, or another sweater. Second, I can take it off easily (whereas the ones I had before were such a pain to take off). Thirdly, this has THREE pockets, so I can put my sunglasses in the top pocket, and the dog leash into the second and third pockets (they connect), or bigger items when I need my hands. And the brown color is so beautiful! Thank you. Backcountry! I hope this fleece will come out with more colors in the Spring because it is now my favorite to wear!
review.name: Love, love, LOVE this fleece!!!

review.reviewBody: Love this pullover! Got the gold with pink trim and love the contrast. Super soft, fuzzy and warm! Just love it!
review.name: My Most Favorite!

review.reviewBody: I always wear a size small top. This runs small and short for a 5’7” woman. Had to return for bigger size to allow for any layering at all.
review.name: Runs Small and Short

review.reviewBody: I already owned this in another color so I was thrilled to see this new color that goes with some of my other gear. Thankfully it is exactly the same quality and fit. I like the variety of pockets and the length of the zipper. Love this!
review.name: Classic!

review.reviewBody: I've had the Los Gatos for years and it was my favorite fleece ever. My one wish was that it had pockets, so when I saw this jacket I knew I had to try it. It's just as cozy and soft as my Los Gatos, but with pockets! I also love the fit and the fun color combo.
review.name: Perfect Fleece

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been wearing the bushido for a long time and on some advice of another runner gave these a try. I wore them for just a few runs and had instant knee pain. As soon as I switched back to my “hard” bushidos the knee pain went  away and my runs have been great since. I think for me the tread was just a little too high and that changed my gait. Still a massive fan of their trail shoes as I have narrow feet and this brand has been the best!
review.name: Switched back to bushido

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these shoes. I have both this style and the previous style. They provide excellent traction and comfort. I have a narrow foot and I it is difficult to find proper fitting shoes and these "fit" the bill. I also have their hiking boots and they are great. With both the running shoe and hiking boot, I have had to go up in size. I normally wear 7.5-8 and I ordered 8.5 for both.
review.name: Great for hiking

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love the cushion. Nice shoes. 
Fits the perfect amount of narrow in the arch, but the toe box is like a mm too tight. Got a blood blister on a 15 mile run. Hope they update this model with a few tweaks!
review.name: Toe Box didn’t make the cut

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Please, please, please bring back the features of the helio II. They are the only trail shoe I have been able to run in for 4 years... I was hopeful for the III but the changes are not good for me. The back of the shoe has way less padding on the Achilles area and I have gotten awful pain from them on all of my runs trying to work them into my rotation. Also the tongue of the shoe is much thinner at the top and almost sharp, even with tall socks it cuts into the front of the ankel. The quick lace system is also gone on this new model... something I loved about the IIs. The shoe is also much narrower than the previous ones and runs big as well compared to the last model. I do not mean to bash the new design, but I hope it saves some people from being so disappointed after loving the previous model so much. I have been scouring the internet and stores trying to find the previous model bow because I do not see me being able to race and distance in these new shoes. I love your products and just hope that enough feedback comes in to go back to the previous design!!!
review.name: Bring back the Helio II design

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been running in the Helios for about ten years and was dismayed when they briefly disappeared from the sportiva lineup. This model has a more rigid/stiff heal. I preferred the previous style that generally felt softer. I also preferred the quick lace system on the older model. Other than that, still an excellent shoe- great for most trails and pavement.
review.name: Prefer the earlier models

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've worn these twice this week on routes where I ran a mix of pavement and dirt trail. One of the things I first noticed was how incredibly lightweight these shoes are-the lightest pair of trail shoes I own. My foot is not wide, and these are super comfortable. I like the color (Clay/Hibiscus) and they have great traction. Because I'm prone to spraining my ankle, I wouldn't wear these on highly technical rocky trails (I wear the LaSpo Ultra Raptor), but I do love them for less technical runs. I think they'd make great race shoes as they are so lightweight.
review.name: Great lightweight running shoes!

name: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Fusion Drive Pro 600 Plus Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I was unhappy to try this out on my bike and find out it does not stay on my bars without spinning around, especially in the rain. It also scratched my new handlebars because it has a metal bolt right where it attaches to the bike. Additionally, the plug for the charging port to prevent water from getting inside comes out very easily when the  light rotates on the attachment assembly. This did not live up to my expectations but now I am stuck using it, I should have bit the bullet and got another lights in motion light which has always stayed on my bike pointed in the right direction and never damaged my bike. Would not recommend. The light itself is bright and well designed, but I will need to Jerry-rig the attachment.
review.name: Poor attachment mechanism and water plug

name: Fusion Drive Pro 600 Plus Headlight

review.reviewBody: Our boy had a Reima snowsuit for 2 years now that was given by friends to us and it is incredibly good. It was worn in total for 5 years on everyday base and still looks like new! So now it became slightly small and Ive ordered him a new one and one for our baby girl as well. She will be wearing her brother's ones once grows up because i know they will last forever! Amazing quality :ok_hand: No need to buy bigger sizes, they are plein sizes and even run big a bit, but its great cause its not tight, movements are free and kids and very comfortable:ok_hand: colors are amazing. Ive ordered mittens as well and they are so easy to put, kids loved them as well! Hands stay warm!!! Very happy with my purchases! Very good investment!!!
review.name: Amazing Snowsuits

review.reviewBody: So warm and cute. Runs a little big so it will fit my grandson next year too.. the best snowsuit I have seen.
review.name: Warm and cozy…

review.reviewBody: Great color and quality of the fabric, durable and easy to clean. Keeps my son dry and warm while playing in the snow. I like the straps to keep pants inside the boot and snow out. Perfect outer layer.
review.name: Dry and warm

review.reviewBody: Adorable high quality snowsuit. I love the generous sizing.
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: This is my second one of these! I LOVE it! It is pricey, but definitely worth it. My daughters never get cold when we go outdoors for activities. Definitely recommend it!
review.name: This is my second one

review.reviewBody: Could not have expected such a great snow day in El Paso, Texas! Bought the outfits for a ski vacation and playing on the country club golf course was a warm, wonderful, waterproof happy day!
review.name: Could not have expected such

review.reviewBody: We love the suits so far! I wish the toddler suit had the Velcro feature for the hood but otherwise the kids seem very comfortable and warm in their suits.
review.name: We love the suits so

review.reviewBody: This is snowsuit has been great for my outdoor loving 3.5 year old! I ordered a size 3T with the hopes she could wear it for two seasons. My child is 38 inches and has a long torso, and this suit has enough space for her to grow. Even though it’s a bit big (as described by Reima), her movement hasn’t been impeded at all. I would say it fits closer to a large 4T. She’s played in the snow and gone skiing, and it’s kept her very toasty all day. I could tell as soon as I opened it that the quality Is high. This suit will survive multiple children over a long period of time. I’ll definitely continue purchasing Reima products.
review.name: Awesome snowsuit!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this snowsuit! It runs a little big (room to grow!) but still fits her well and she can walk around just fine. I could see us getting at least 2 seasons out of it. Love the fur around the hood, keeps the snow out and her neck warm if the hood is off. The straps to put around snow boots are super helpful so the legs stay down and the snow stays out. We live in CO so sometimes it’s cold and snowy, other times the sun is out and it’s 40 degrees. I chose this suit so that on the colder days, we could layer w/long underwear and a mid layer..and for warmer days, maybe just a base layer. Love all of Reima’s products!
review.name: Best snowsuit on the market

review.reviewBody: It’s a must . It’s cute and great quality. He’s 4 th winter jacket and overall .
review.name: Love it

name: Gotland Snowsuit - Infants'

hasVariant.name: Hip Monkey 8L Lumbar Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Hip Monkey 8L Lumbar Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have been using MR products professionally and personally for many years. I needed a small pack to carry medical supplies on a rotor wing air ambo, as I didn’t want to weigh down my flight suit. This pack is the perfect size for those frequently used items, and the structure of the back (which is removable) is perfect for use as a sling. Thank you MR for coming through again, whether it be fire, medical, or off duty use!
review.name: Exactly What I was Looking For

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag a month ago because I needed something for work that was smaller than a full sized messenger/lap top bag and larger than one of the Hip Monkey Mystery Ranch waist bags. I often find my carrying too many items if I have the space to do so. The Mystery Ranch Indie is perfect for bringing along with me just what I need for work - a  7 X 6 sketchbook, a 16 oz tumbler, a sandwich, my headphones, chargers, and a pencil case.. and that is just the main compartment. The outside pockets are good for stashing my wallet, my phone, pocket knife and several M95 masks. My only complaint is I wish the strap was a bit wider (it’s 1 1/2 in, I would’ve liked it to have been 2 in), but the length works just fine.
review.name: Great every day use bag?

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a trip to Wales where lots of walking was involved. Since them I’ve used it as a pack for small hikes and dog walking. Pros: It is roomy (it fit a packable rain layer, hat, small hydrapak stow, wallet, passport , phone and snacks with room to spare. The wide waist belt is comfortable and the cinch straps allow you to carry any size load without things flopping around. Offers hands free carrying with no strain on neck or shoulders. Well made with high quality zippers, pulls, straps and buckles. Cons: It comes with a stiff plastic shield that velcros into the back panel (against your back). Meant to give structure to the pack, I found it a nuisance and removed it, gaining more storage flexibility and comfort. Waist buckle is big and hard to open for my smaller hands. I have to fiddle with it. It’s not coming apart without effort. As others mention, the lack of strap retainers is annoying but it’s not hard to come up with a diy solution. Also, there is not a lot of internal organization which might be a con for some. I use small pouches to sort stuff so its open storage didn’t bother me.  I like the pack (pebble color is great) and would purchase again.
review.name: Nice big fanny pack

review.reviewBody: I debated purchasing this bag for a few years. I constantly rotate bags for work, biking around, fly fishing, and hiking around. This bag is sleek enough I love wearing it with just a few small things OR I can pack with a ton of stuff. I frequently carry a sweater, windbreaker, water bottle, nitecore battery pack, and other small items. Would for sure recommend!
review.name: Everything I wanted it to be and more!

review.reviewBody: Its pro and con is the size. I heard that it was going to be big but I didn't know it was that big. I want to buy another smaller bag in the future but as of now, this bag carrys my fullsize handgun comfortably. I love the quick strap adjustment feature.
review.name: Big size

review.reviewBody: Not sure what the purpose of the bag is or how to use it. If I could return it I would, had it longer than 30 days due to being out of town.
review.name: Purpose

review.reviewBody: The only think I would recommend would be a strap tail management system. I bought the little Velcro things that you guys sell to do that, so it’s all good. It would be cool to see those sewn in more though. Tiny item of possible improvement. Amazing bag though!
review.name: Incredible Quality. Great size.

review.reviewBody: I have used the hip monkey for a full year and love it. It's the perfect size to fit all my essentials - first aid kit, water filtration, tech gadgets, etc. readily available without needing to carry a full back pack. The one thing I wish it had would be molle webbing on the side flaps to allow for mounting a water bottle holder on one side a small pouch on the other ... but I knew it didn't have that going in so not losing any stars over it. Great pack!
review.name: Perfect size for quick day hikes

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag before traveling and it was a good daily pack for essentials. Nothing too crazy but a solid hip/crossbody bag.
review.name: Good Little Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this pouch/bag at Christmas for an upcoming Elk trip in New Mexico. As always, Mystery Ranch products are top notch. The materials, the zippers, webbing, and color choice are all great choices. I know I needed a new small carry pouch for my med kit and some other items. This fit the bill and will have years of service and memories. I could not be any happier. Thanks guys!
review.name: Hip Monkey adventures

name: Hip Monkey 8L Lumbar Pack

review.reviewBody: I knew my daughter in law would like these, but no, she LOVED them! They're so comfy and cute and she really loved the color, and also the thicker sole. It was a 10 out of 10 on the happy scale.
review.name: Maes a GREAT gift!

review.reviewBody: UGG Coquette slippers is all I wear. I have difficult feet to find shoes for. Once from buying very famous sliders I got bursitis in the hip. With that said I tried different slippers in the UGG family, because they were on sale. Right away I can tell they weren't for me, so I returned them. Ever since I don't try anymore. Every year my husband knows UGG Coquette size 9 and he just ask me for the color. I'm more natural colors girl, but I might run out and go crazy. For me the most comfortable slipper for inside and outside. It so so soft, especially at 1st. I love wearing them barefooted. Very warm. I got the cleaning solution from UGG but my last pair was black and I didn't have to use it. The slippers also have plenty of support. I love everything about them! Highly recommend!
review.name: I'm in love

review.reviewBody: It's so comfortable and soft. Perfect for the fall weather approaching!
review.name: Definitely I would purchase a second pair!

review.reviewBody: It's really pretty but the fur on it isn't really white like the picture its like yellow
review.name: loved it

review.reviewBody: Truly quality slippers that have lasted me over a decade. I received my first pair as a Christmas gift in 2010. I am just now purchasing a replacement pair...14 years later. My original pair saw me through both high school and college graduation. Too funny. Couldnt recommend more.
review.name: Long lasting

review.reviewBody: The inside bottom seems to clump and bother my feet
review.name: Not sure

review.reviewBody: The shoe is great. But it runs one size larger then your other products. Why? If there is no consensus to how the shoe should be labeled for size it makes it difficult to buy online. Other then that I love the look and will continue to buy Ugg.
review.name: Size does not size up

review.reviewBody: my first pair of UGGs were purchased in 2019 when I was having cancer surgery and my loving husband bought me these exact UGGs for ease of slipping my feet in and out as I could not bend at that time fast-forward to 2024 I've had the same pair of UGGs since 2019 and I just purchased a new pair and they are just as comfy as the ones my husband bought in 2019. These will be always in rotation in my home.
review.name: My Favorite slipper

review.reviewBody: I purchased the slippers, and I absolutely love them very comfortable and easy fit.
review.name: I would definitely buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my daughter and she won't take them off! Love them. Also her 1st pair of adult size shoes and the 5 fit perfectly.
review.name: Daughter's Delight
