review.reviewBody:
I was definitely disappointed by these pants, as a convert over to Rab clothing 6+ years ago and who loves their gear. Their stuff is usually very well designed and fitting. These are not either in numerous respects. 

They're built like clowns pants, with a whole host of excess space and material in the legs, which run shorter than expected to boot. Topping it off, the zippers are horrible - the top ones on each leg don't stay in place, even in just trying them on for fit, quickly sliding down from the top of the waist at least six inches in minimal movement - something that would drive nuts to have to fiddle with in active wear/use and constantly needing to pull them back up. 

I wouldn't want to use these in climbing or mountaineering, they would be way too easy to catch fabric on something and rip the pants. 

On the plus side, the front pockets are well positioned and I like they have the option for a belt, in addition to having elastic in the waist in the back, as well as offer a zip fly for a bio break. Seem like they'd be warm for winter use.
review.name: Need works. Ill fitting with bad zippers

review.reviewBody: Used these climbing Mt. Rainier. Fortunately the weather was warm enough (15 Degrees) while we were moving so I didn't need them.  But they worked great for lounging around camp as the temps dropped and the sun disappeared. Very Warm, especially when layered with a baselayer.
review.name: Kept Me Warm

review.reviewBody:
I bought these trousers to take with me when I climb Kilimanjaro. I wanted an insulated trouser for those cold nights around the camp and also for summit night itself.

They’re easily the warmest trouser I have ever owned, when it was recently in the minus weather here in the UK, these were epic. I was probably still too warm when I wore them outside and this was with just underwear underneath. 

Fit wise is perfect, I’m a 32 and given these are meant to go over additional clothing they’re spot on. The only thing I would say is they’re no way as fitted as the picture would have you suggest, but that doesn’t bother me. They’re a quality pair of trousers that are going to be my best friend on the mountain, during winter and when I go skiing.

I made the right selection buying these!
review.name: I bought these trousers to

review.reviewBody:
Don't generally write reviews until I've had a piece of kit for at least a four season year and have used extensively.
Bought these primarily for sitting around inside/outside the campervan in the colder months. What a hit! BUT, have also been used on bothying and camping trips. Great to pull on over fleecy leggings for a toasty evening long cosiness. Haven't tried them cragging yet but would probably be great for a standing around session. Used a couple of times in the Scottish mountains winter season but a bit warm for general mountaineering. Really wish I'd had a pair of these during my Mountain Rescue days.
Only downside is that the zips tend to get caught in the fabric quite frequently.
review.name: Photon Insulated Pants

review.reviewBody: The Photon pants are, without doubt, the best purchase I have made for my outdoor pursuits. For standing around camp and cooking out in chilly conditions, insulation on the legs is highly underrated. They have kept me comfortably warm for hours when being inactive. They're also perfect for at the crag ice climbing as they fully unzip down each leg, allowing for them to be put on with crampons on. When doing any winter activity, I also always pack the Photon pants as part of my winter emergency kit to keep any injured party member warm (along with emergency bivvy and a way of getting a hot drink).
review.name: Best purchase to date.

review.reviewBody: Work well, compact when packed, very warm. Very happy with them for high mountain adventures
review.name: Work well, compact when packed,

review.reviewBody: Comfy, warm and unrestrictive when climbing. Easy on/off even with crampons. Great addition to the kit list.
review.name: Comfy, warm and unrestrictive when

review.reviewBody:
One of the best purchases I have ever made. Tons of warmth for weight- I run warm and can comfortably sit around in these in temperatures close to 10 degrees F. Any lower and I throw on another layer on. With activity, however, I?ve easily taken these down to below zero F, and really haven?t found their limit yet ( -10 F is the lowest I?ve been active in these). They pack down small, and are easy to wash. They repel light rain well, and snow bounces right off . These are also tough- I run dogs in the winter and have had Alaskan Huskies jumping all over my pants consistently. Not even a scratch. 

I also live off grid in a bell tent and, as the title says, live in these this time of year. I only really take them off to work indoors or wash them. Get yourself a pair- whatever you think you?ll need them for, you?ll be glad to have them. They are worth the size and weight in your pack, and double as a pillow if it?s too warm. Awesome job, Rab.
review.name: I live in these

review.reviewBody: The photon pants are my ideal harsh conditions pants. The reinforced sections on the knees are perfectly placed for snowy skin transitions and mountaineering in mixed terrain, holding up against rock as well as keeping out snow. Since they pack small, I'll pack these even on warmer days if I care to hang out on a windy summit and take in the view a bit longer before heading down the mountain!
review.name: When the weather goes south...

name: Photon Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I've tried to use this hose several times now and each and every time I can't get enough pressure for my Everest x2 stove. It will put put out high pressure to begin with but quickly lose any pressure and putter out. 
Can't cook if the hose doesn't work, which is great in the mountains, as much as I have appreciated the low calorie diet, I think I'd rather have cooked food.
review.name: Poor quality
comment: Hello and thank you for your review. We want to assure you that we truly are a company that stands behind their products and take pride in our customer support. Please reach out to customer service at support@campchef.com or 1-800-650-2433 and they will be happy to help as quickly as possible.

review.reviewBody: Item was shipped with very little delay. Adapter worked well with this stove.
review.name: Great order fulfillment

review.reviewBody: Nice option to make shopping easy and the price is not over priced. Standard easy to use adapter.
review.name: Hose adapter easy to use

review.reviewBody: We got what we order. It came in perfect condition, no issues. We received the order on time per tracking information. Easy to install on the stove.
review.name: Good product, no delays

review.reviewBody: Disappointed for the price it wasn’t threaded for the old and new cyclinder tank threads!!!!!
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
The hose came quickly and it went on like it was supposed to. Long enough to use, but not too long.
The ends screwed on without a hitch and it worked perfectly. Just wished it came with the oven...
review.name: smooth sailing!

review.reviewBody: Can get the same hose at the local sportings good store for half the price.
review.name: Exact fit

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a friend and he is extremely happy with it.
review.name: Great for Camping

review.reviewBody: I enjoy having a bulk tank hose for each appliance when we are on an extended family campout.  It's fun to have disposables for a picnic, but that's about it.  I like to keep a hose set in each of my ovens so I don't have to find one when I want it.
review.name: Ready for a trip

review.reviewBody: This hose adapter allows one to use bulk lp tank rather than more expensive disposable cylinders.  Works perfectly on the Weber Q series.
review.name: Hose adapter

name: Bulk Tank Hose Adapter

review.reviewBody: These are the best hats ever! I have owned 2 hats over his 13-year period, and  there's never been any problems with craftsmanship. They keep your head and neck much cooler. Highly recommend, since I highly recommend this hat to many other people i know other people
review.name: Great, cool hat!...even if some dont like the look

review.reviewBody: Over 20 years with this hat. Several replacements.
review.name: The only hat for me.

review.reviewBody: Excellent service - replacing my defective hat with the upgraded model.  I couldn’t be happier!
review.name: Above and beyond warranty service

review.reviewBody:
My dermatologist recommended Sunday Afternoons and I’m really glad she did. For health reasons, more than ever, I need to really hide from sun exposure but I am not one to just stay inside.

 I’m usually an Akubra girl, but the Adventure Hat has better coverage and the ventilation makes it so much more comfortable in these increasingly hot summer days. It’s sturdy, comfortable and adjustable. The chin strap is effective and keeps the hat on even in a strong gust. It’s attractive too; I’ve had many compliments on it and it even inspired my cousin to buy a couple Sunday Afternoon hats for herself. It is unquestionably an all-around great hat.
review.name: All around great hat

review.reviewBody: Colors too dark . Wish they would make it in white
review.name: Need white adventure hat

review.reviewBody: Need White color adventure hat  white matches with everything
review.name: Adventure hat in white

review.reviewBody: Light weight and yet very sturdily made.  Fast delivery as well.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody:
Such a delight to have a new hat after 40 years of canoeing and kayaking. The material seems softer and 
the soft blue tone just right. Always have appreciated my hats. Excellent sun shade!
review.name: Unique hat for everyday adventures and more.

review.reviewBody: Purchased several years ago and still going strong. For whatever reason, dear flies and other pests seem to stay away. Also protects my neck against the sun and bug bites.
review.name: Great for the outdoors and flying pests

review.reviewBody: Perfect hat for all your expeditions. Wide brim offers great sun protection. Adjustable cord kept the hat firmly on during windy zodiac trips ashore. Material is breathable and provides nice neck coverage.
review.name: Sun Hat

name: Adventure Hat

review.itemreviewed: Lyngen Alpha100 Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Loved this jacket - weather protective exterior and nice fleece interior. HOWEVER, like others stated the arm seams are very sharp so, will scratch your arm/wrist if not wearing a long sleeve underneath. The hood and pockets are spot on. But, returning due to the seam issue. True bummer
review.name: Great Fleece Jacket BUT

review.itemreviewed: Lyngen Alpha100 Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Trying to figure out Norrona as an alternative to Arc'teryx, and so far I am pleased. This piece is a good jacket, holds heat surprisingly well for it's weight and thickness, probably courtesy of the Polartec Alpha. Small fits well, a bit long on the torso, but nothing out of the norm for a mid or outer layer. Working well today, 40F, walking around outside with a thin base later and vest underneath. 

Is a bit crinkly and noisy, but that doesn't seem to impact the feel so far. There are two stitches on the inside of the end of the sleeves, which have stitching that occasionally scratches my wrists in an unpleasant manner. 

Overall, works well for me! Glad I got it. Would compare it to a bit noisier Atom LT, perhaps not quite as warm, but so far doing a good job as a replacement.
review.name: Meeting Expectations

review.itemreviewed: Lyngen Alpha100 Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Packs tight, small, and weighs nothing.  Warmth to weight ratio is incredible but breathes enough for high cardio activities.  Full mobility and oh so comfortable.  Not an activity I wouldn't use it for, in fact, I'm wearing it right now.  I love it for cold, windy days on the skin track.  Not waterproof enough for rain, but plenty of protection from blowing snow.  So thin it's a great option as a layer under a shell, as it won't restrict your movement.  Also a go to for cold weather hiking, I throw it on for late season biking as well.   Looks super sharp, you'll grab it for trips to the store, and nights out.  If you're searching for a do everything layer, this is it!
review.name: Excels at All!

review.itemreviewed: Lyngen Alpha100 Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have the vest version of this - both the original and newer version, and wear them nearly every day in the fall/winter/spring.  This jacket completes the package. I wear this all winter long outside over a flannel down to 20F, and under my goretex shell for skiing when its super cold.  Also packs down pretty well for popping into a backpack. Warm, lightweight, looks great. Five stars as usual, Norrona.
review.name: Amazing & Versatile

review.itemreviewed: Lyngen Alpha100 Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Disappointing design.  The outer fabric is not a breathable material, which sort of negates the whole point of making a midlayer with Polartec Alpha.  Fabric is also stiff and crinkly so not as comfortable.
review.name: Not breathable

name: Lyngen Alpha100 Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is cozy and warm. It is the perfect length too. I love the light weight of it and the snaps in front. I highly recommend for throwing on to take walks and as a driving coat. It washed and dried on delicate and came out perfect!
review.name: Super Warm and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket for winter — my go to jacket for the snow
review.name: Great winter jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great coat! Love the longer length, warm and not bulky I own 2 one for work (I work outside on occasion) one to keep for nicer occasions.
review.name: Nisquallyrose

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and water resistant. It is a puffy coat and a little bit bigger.
review.name: Keeps me warm
comment: Hello, thank you for leaving the review on our product. We strive for excellence and we are really happy to hear that our product met the high standard we set for ourselves. We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great color, design, and material. Very warm. Great parka with hood from a well-known brand name.
review.name: Super Nice!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is very warm and light. I love the large hood that I can use even when I am wearing a beanie. I wish the piece inside the arms was a bit tighter to prevent the air getting in. It does run large. I am generally Small in other brand of winter jackets (5'6", 110 pounds), but XS of this jacket is still big for me. Also the snaps are very hard to shut. But overall a great jacket when on sale.
review.name: Love the large hood and deep pockets.

review.reviewBody: We were looking for a toasty jacket that would be effective against the extreme Canadian winter but the jacket had to be as light as a couple of feathers! I am very pleased with this jacket because it checked my boxes. And budget friendly too!
review.name: Great purchase Marmot

review.reviewBody: Light weight & warm (not my warmest down coat though),  Great pockets -- I have the strollbrodge coat also in a different color) and a nice length.  I appreciate the hidden and sturdy zipper. The snaps are a little hard to shut.  I wish the hood were detachable.  My fault for not noticing this, but I probably would have bought the coat anyway.  I wish it didn't say "Marmot" on the front of the coat -- that's not my name -- but fortunately it doesn't show up very prominently.  On the whole, I'm glad I bought it and the sale price was great.
review.name: More chic than the photo conveys

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and warm parka; I like the deep
Pockets too can use for storing wallet and keys or keep hands warm. I am very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Great cold weather parka

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It came larger than expected. It also felt less warm than I was hoping.
review.name: Review
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our parka. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the Women's Strollbridge Parka has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your feedback on the sizing and warmth to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM-5PM Eastern Time.

Thank you! 
Marmot Consumer Care

name: Strollbridge Parka - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Foxy Baby Sherpa Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this.  It is softer than you can imagine.  While our lil guy won’t wear the hood yet, here’s to hoping.  Would certainly buy again.

review.itemreviewed: Foxy Baby Sherpa Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been buying the Foxy Sherpa Jackets in different sizes for years; my most recent purchase was my fifth or sixth. All the previous ones have been a thick sherpa fleece material, making them thicker/warmer than the regular fleece jackets. Unfortunately, this latest one is your typical thin fleece, like what’s used in Columbia’s other fleece jackets. It’s still cute, but not the thickness/warmth I was hoping for based on previous purchases. I went back and looked at the listing pictures more closely, and it appears that some colors are the thicker sherpa fleece, but others are the thin stuff. Pay close attention if the type of fleece matters to you.
review.name: Very cute, but not all are thick sherpa fleece!

review.itemreviewed: Foxy Baby Sherpa Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: It keeps my son warm. My son really loves it because it has fox ears
review.name: Son really loves it

description: Buy the Stan's NoTubes DART Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: DART Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stan's NoTubes DART Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: went through an entire 5 pack or whatever, not one single one worked, even for a second, the black part just breaks off immediately, in every single one, so all it did was make the hole bigger and doesn't seal anything. Dynaplugs have always been perfect but i've lost two on the trail so I was hoping for a cheaper option. Not this cheap though.
review.name: the most useless garbage

review.reviewBody:
I've bought two Dart tools and a replenishment kit for my 32mm Continental Gran Prix 5000 road bike tires. This plastic tool has not fixed any of the three punctures I experienced on the road over the last year. ="

The Dynaplug repair kit is metal and has worked 100% on the two punctures I needed to repair. This is a more expensive option, but it actually works!
review.name: Doesn't work

review.reviewBody: I pressed the tip of the plug through my tire and the rubber part of the plug slid up the stem of the applicator.  This happened with both plugs.
review.name: Didn't work for me.  Buy something else.

review.reviewBody: I love Stan's no-tubes for preventing punctures.  However, when it comes to the Dart Tool, my experience is like others here, I have found on 4 tries now (2 each on two punctures) the little sharp tip penetrates the tire but the patch itself just gets pushed up into the tool and is wasted.  Doesn't seem to matter if you enlarge the hole or not.  The worst part is how you get to think about how you have relied on this piece of crab while you walk your bike 6 miles back to the car.  Back to carrying a spare tube for emergencies.  Tom
review.name: Avoid this product - not worth it
comment: I had the exact same experience went through 5 plugs, the plastic piece separated from the plug material every time.

review.reviewBody: I actually needed to use this today, and it failed miserably. Apparently my tire was too thick or the hole too small; the plastic arrowhead would not easily fit through the puncture, and applying more force broke the carbon stabber post thing, rendering the whole thing useless. Fortunately a buddy had a good ol' metal fork-type plug with bacon strips, which worked great. I would absolutely not trust this thing to fix a tire to get me home.
review.name: Garbage
comment: Exactly the same problems I have had and seen. Wish they would add a reamer or steel driver for the dart plug.

review.reviewBody: I tried 3 times to plus a tire with a small hole and the tip went inside and the rubber wouldn?t. Used a bacon strip and still using the tire. Don?t buy this product
review.name: Junk

review.reviewBody:
I have a gravel bike with WTB tires that got a cut in the center tread. The stans sealant would not close the hole so I used a bacon strip. As long as I kept the psi low in the tire it got me home. The tires were new so I thought I would buy the Stan's Darts to try and save the tire.

I added fresh Stan's sealant to the tire and then tried to insert the dart. The first one I tried failed. The plastic tip inserted in the tire and the plug just pushed up the pin on the tool rendering it useless. I tried a second dart and it did the same thing.

I contacted Stan's and they said the hole might not have been large enough for the dart. They replaced the darts under warranty with free shipping. Happy about Stan's customer service, disappointed in the dart.
review.name: Not what I was hoping for

review.reviewBody:
Had a puncture and watched the how to video. Tip went in but the rubber piece stayed outside the tire. Figured hole was too small, enlarged it and tried again. 
Same result.
review.name: No go
comment: Same experience. Back to the bacon

review.reviewBody: Just started running tubeless. Put this thing in my saddle bag on the recommendation of my gear head. Out with the guys and one of us got a big side-wall hole. It really worked! We put about 40 more gravel miles on that fix with no issues. Recommend watching the video on this so you know how to use it. NOTE: it is not recommended for punctures smaller than 5mm.  For those the sealant alone is supposed to work. I just ordered a refill pack.
review.name: It really worked

name: DART Tool

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a trip. Breaking them in now and they are perfect
review.name: Svalbard bound

review.reviewBody: My granddaughter goes to a cold weather university and wanted these to wear every day to keep her feet warm and dry.  She asked for them for Christmas. As soon as she opened the box she put them on right away and did not take them off.  She was thrilled.
review.name: Hit with my granddaughter

review.reviewBody: These boots are warm and comfortable from the first use
review.name: Warm and stylish

review.reviewBody: Great quality for the price! Will continue to purchase sorel brand shoes each time due to the great quality and that the product lasts.
review.name: Sorel review

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They are warm and comfy!  They have become my new daily go to shoe. It is getting cold out but these keep my feet warm and look good.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: I love these winter boots!! They are comfy, warm, waterproof, and sooo cute.
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: These boots are super cute- In the store they fit great and were comfortable but when I ordered them online the right foot doesn’t feel good it’s tight and uncomfortable. The left foot is great
review.name: In store great online order not as comfortable
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and made with care and quality. Love them !
review.name: Warm and comfortable boots

review.reviewBody: It’s the perfect winter boot. Sturdy, waterproof and stylish.
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: They warm warm, stylish, easy to put on/pull off, comfortable, sturdy ... what else can you ask for? I agree w/ other reviews re: the size. I sized up by a 1/2 size and that was good, but I prob could have sized up a full size (I'm normally an 8, I got an 8.5 but I could have gotten away with a 9 if I wanted even more room). I have a bunion on one of my feet so having that extra space helps me personally. Overall I am very happy with these boots and will prob buy a second pair to make sure I have them in case they stop making this style!
review.name: Love these boots!

name: Tivoli V Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, they give me the confidence and grip to continue running through icy winter conditions.
review.name: Spikecross

review.reviewBody: This is my hubby's first winter of running, so I bought him these. He loved them, so now I will be buying a pair. He said they are excellent for running on snow and icy walkways and keep his feet dry. The fit is true to size for him.
review.name: Husband Loved His So I'm Buying a Pair

review.reviewBody: As a trail runner, I went through the speedcross 3 to the 5 and enjoyed the massive lugs, lightweight material, protective and ergonomic fit around my ankle. Salomon took these brilliant characteristics of the speedcross and added them to the spikecross. The waterproofing is superb (especially when using the Trail Gaiters High) if you are planning on being in deeper snow. The spikes cling to snow, slush and ice with ease without you having to worry about slipping while keeping a consistent pace uphill AND downhill. Great product for ice running!! I wear a 9 in the speedcross and a 9 in the spikecross felt no different.
review.name: INCREDIBLE ICE RUNNING SHOES

review.reviewBody: Peace of mind on icy tracks, these shoes are awesome, and comfortable. The speed cross is my go to summer hiking shoe, and these spike cross are now my go to winter walking and hiking shoes. Unisex M6/W7 fits as well as W only 7, and might be a bit wider which I do like.
review.name: These are great shoes!

review.reviewBody:
This is my third pair. Couldn't go through an Alaskan winter without them, whether it is on icy city streets or on trails. These shoes are like buying insurance.
Replaced last pair after 4 winters of 20 miles a week avg. use and are still wearable.  Cushioning is gave out.
review.name: Winter Life Saver

review.reviewBody: I am after a pair of trainers that can walk on ice and tough terrain? Any recommendations??
review.name: Excellent design

review.reviewBody:
Have owned many pairs of Salomons over the years, but this is the first pair of spiked shoes I have purchased.  Was tired of stretchy rubber solutions, so gave this a try.  Works very well, highly recommended. 

Comes with 12 spikes, I ordered some additional studs and put a 13th stud in the middle of the heel, does help considerably with rear heel slippage.

Users, don't be shy about adding studs to these if you want more ice grip.

Great shoe and looking forward to using these more next winter!
review.name: Works as advertised, one small modification

review.reviewBody:
I bought this recently but the fit guide was wrong, upon requesting a refund I had to get a box, because I tossed it out  = my fault. 
the refund came back without the shipping cost.
review.name: SHIPPING portion is non refundable
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Love the spikes, enabling a run in a park I usually can’t run Dec-March  due to ice. Lace-up is convenient for cold fingers, with the pull tuck-box invention.  Will recommend to my 84-yr- old mom for safe grocery shopping through iced parking lots, and mail fetching. Enables winter life!
review.name: Love!  Enjoyed Lake Elmo park ice run today

review.reviewBody: I haven’t put many miles on these yet, but they add some extra traction when running on icy surfaces compared to my speedcross shoes.  I think the studs could be a little longer to help grip in snow/slush better, but I definitely feel more secure in these than my speedcross in similar conditions.
review.name: Good show for icy conditions

name: Spikecross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe

review.reviewBody: Top quality have used these now 5 different  trips the fit is great size is adequate  for the ones I ordered   time will tell how well they hold up

G3 waders are just the ticket for me. High quality materials: durable, flexible, optimum weight. Adding the pants to my full wader set gives me the best option for water and weather conditions. Adding a small back pocket would be a nice feature.
review.name: Just the ticket.

review.reviewBody: My other guide buddy said the zipper breaks easy. No problem for me yet.
review.name: Waders

review.reviewBody: Lightweight but still lock in the heat with some underlayering and good socks. The zip closure makes in and out easy. Quick drying and durable so far after 1 winter. I miss the pockets from my last pair of Simms guide pants however.
review.name: My daily drivers

review.reviewBody:
Best pant wader on market.Fit perfect 
5'10" 170 lbs 33 waist medium short.
review.name: Best out there

review.reviewBody:
These are my 2nd pair of wader pants 
My first pair lasted me over 15 years 
Great fitting product
Awesome when the weather warms up and you’re chest waders are just to hot and clumsy to wear

Seems like a nice product but runs small.  I bought the size recommended via the online system and it is way too small.  I'm no body builder but am reasonably fit and there's no way I can even climb stairs in these, let alone wade.
review.name: Made for twig legs?

review.reviewBody: Wore the simms G3 wading pant on a 14 day 120 mile river float moose hunt in alaska. Put them through pure abuse the entire time and never got wet and stayed dry and comfortable the entire time despite being in water and rain constantly . Worn with the simms guide boots I was very impressed. It’s the only time I’ve hunted alaska with dry feet the whole time.
review.name: Simms G3 wading pant- durable and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I’ve always been a fan of the pants style waders.  the G3 Guide pants are comfortable, fit great, and made solid.   You won’t be disappointed with them.
review.name: G3  guide pants.

review.reviewBody: Love these waders for warmer weather fishing. Very high quality waters. Simms are the best. Sizing was right on.
review.name: Awesome Warm Weather Waders

name: G3 Guide Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am very prone to having cold fingers and toes. These shoes are very warm. If it gets too cold, I wear a bootie over them.
review.name: Great Vold Weather Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I was a bit put off by reading the reviews on the former iteration of the Artica shoes, but thought I'd give these a try and return them if they didn't live up to expectations. Riding in the rain is just a fact of life if you live in the PNW and want to commute or just get some outdoor miles in between October and April. These do great in the rain. Never had a drop of rain enter them when paired with the Assos Bonka tights with the neoprene leg sleeves that fit nicely over the tops of these shoes. 

As for the cold, I am a complete wimp when it comes to cold. I wear tights and long sleeves until about 78 degrees. I have never been cold in these shoes at all. They are very impressive in their ability to keep my feet warm. Never tried them with booties, but I have to imagine you'd stay really toasty with the combo. 

All in all, these are a complete win. I'd recommend them to anyone.
review.name: Portland-Proven Winter Shoes

review.reviewBody:
Stiff enough soles for winter use. Single boa again good enough for intended use.
Wore these on days down into single digits (F) with a tie warmer inside.  No issues with cold toes and light wool socks.
They are waterproof but when water starts running down your tights into the shoe it now has no way of getting out and your feet are now sitting in a little pool. Even with waterproof covers it’s an issue to keep in mind.
Poured out half a cup of foot flavored water after a ride today. Very uncomfortable few hours in the rain.
review.name: Decent winter shoe,disappointing in rain

review.reviewBody:
I love these boots.  I live in Olympia WA, so I ride in the rain a lot.  I finally bought myself a pair of these, and oh! what a difference.

A couple of things:
- They do not seem to me to be much warmer than my summer shoes and a booty.  What they are is totally dry.  I am absolutely positive that I could stand in 3" of water for an hour without getting so much as damp.
- They are road shoes: They don't have any tread and the sole is quite stiff. I stick to roads and don't dismount much, myself, so I can't say for sure.  I bet, though, they wouldn't be great in the mud.
- My summer shoes are 42s.  I bought these in 43.5 to leave room for socks.  The fit is slightly looser than the summer shoes, which is perfect for improved winter circulation.

Sick of coming home with cold wet toes.  Do yourself a favor!
review.name: Tested in Seattle

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my partner and he loves them for riding in 38-45 degree weather(s). They tend to run small compared to other Fizik shoes, size up at least a half size.. especially considering that winter socks are generally a tad bit thicker.
review.name: Great winter shoes, but run small

name: Tempo Artica GTX Shoe

description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Abisko Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I took these shorts and another brand on the Camino Frances in 2022.  Over 800 km these outperformed the other brand I used. They still look and wear well. Extremely durable and comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable and durable.

review.reviewBody: I have this shorts for 10 years , a have green dark olive , and dark grey , no regrets 👍🏽
review.name: Comfortable, durable , breathable

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a lot of shorts over the years ( will turn 64 later this year) these shorts are by far the most comfortable and well made pair I’ve worn. Good fit, I usually wear a 34 (U.S. size)  and bought the 50 (Eur size). I use them for everyday wear and find the pockets well thought out and placed. My first pair of shorts that don’t have rear pockets which I was concerned about as I have always carried my phone in my right rear pocket. However not an issue as it fits perfectly in the small mesh pocket in the right leg pocket. It’s an iPhone 13 with a wallet on the back and was a bit snug in the left leg pocket. Both hand pockets are deep easy to access and the zippers work perfectly. The material had good stretch and seems very durable, I expect to have these shorts for many years and can see myself buying a second pair in another colour. I
review.name: I’m impressed!

review.reviewBody: Brilliant bit of kit does exactly what it says on the tin
review.name: Great material and features  dry very wuickly

review.reviewBody:
The BEST!  My go-to pants~~near all year round (SoCal and now Hi)
I own 7 pairs in three colors. Repaired kindly by your shops. In fact, a Khaki pair now coming back from your repair shop after waist button came off.
review.name: The BEST!!

review.reviewBody: simply superb; so well made. I am about to order another pair. The attention to detail is on point!
review.name: Great great shorts

review.reviewBody: Great needlework, highest quality, light enough to wear in Southern Nevada but not so light as to feel insubstantial. Love the new color. Will buy another pair in second color.
review.name: Next Level

review.reviewBody: I bought these based on a friend's recommendation.  After week one, I had a small fire in the back of my truck...long story, but in the process of putting it out, a lot of the melting plastic from my tent and sleeping pads hit my right leg.  Melting and sticking to my shorts. It did not go through and wonderfully enough after many washes, there is only a small hole and a stain from the event.  My lower uncovered bare leg didn't fare as well, but they certainly helped me get the fire out and save my truck.   These short are tough!  I will be buying a second pair for sure.
review.name: Saved my leg from a nasty burn

review.reviewBody: one of the best
review.name: excelent

review.reviewBody:
I have purchased four pairs over as many years, one was nearly identical called Abisko Lite Trekking Shorts but I see no difference, the current "Lite" model does look different.  Anyhow these are simply great from nearly every perspective. Light, but reinforced where you'd want them to be. Stretchy and slim, not baggy and sloppy and yet you never feel constrained by them especially if you have big thighs. I'm very glad there's no back pockets but instead a reinforced seat, my area if NE has much sharp granite you end up sitting on these do well. There's two well thought out low-profile cargo pockets that look sharp and are actually useful. Glad there's a mesh pouch for a phone in one. And low profile zippers for the properly deep hand pockets to keep items from falling out. 

What would I add?  two small plastic snaps on the bottom cuffs so you could roll them up once and get a little more above the knee thigh cooling. I've noticed I do this when I am really working and even without any kind of snap the stretchy material generally keeps the "cuff" and lets me have a shorter short.   Also side vent zips please!. Then these would be absolutely perfect. Anyhow, pair five is being picked up soon.
review.name: I have owned four pairs now, and I love these shorts.

name: Abisko Short - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like Salomon shoes. They're comfortable and fit my feet well. However, with this particular model, I've been using it for almost a year, and the right side of the shoe has started to peel a little. Now it's peeling even more, to the point where rainwater is getting inside the shoe. The other models I've used haven't peeled this easily.
review.name: the right side of the shoe has started to peeling
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fitting shoe, perfect fit for a wide foot.  I just wish there was more options for colors when it comes to wide shoes.
review.name: X ULTRA 4 WIDE GORE-TEX

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoes have held out very well.I have got very high traction out of them.The traction was great until just recent.But of course they are now worn out. I highly recommend these shoes.
review.name: Speedcross 4

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I'll start with the good

They look pretty good on the feet, they're waterproof, they're wide toed.

The bad

A lot if bad with this shoe and it all stems from the construction. I wore these shoes less than 15 times, just casual walking, didnt even get a chance to take them hiking and they started tearing at the toe box. parts of the shoe were separating and the goretex material is very stiff. Ocassionally the shoe would crease in such a way that it would stab into my foot, very uncomfortable but also the creasing caused a hole to form in the shoe. Thankfully I was able to use the warranty, but overall disappointed with the shoe. I really wish Salomon had more wide shoes available.

I love the salomon brand so i'll continue to buy other products, just avoid this shoe and probably most goretex shoes,
review.name: I should've trusted the low reviews
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The X Ultra 4 has been a big disappointment. I have over 20 miles on these shoes and they are still hurting the tops of my feet. What a waste of money. I previously purchased the X Ultra 3 shoes and they were, hands down, the best pair of shoes I have ever owned. I rarely write reviews, but I just want to warn prospective buyers. Don't waste your hard earned money as I have! Salomon, why on earth did you abandon the X Ultra 3 Shoe? It was perfect. I wanted to like these shoes, I really did. 
Sincerely,
Sad in Ohio
review.name: Dissapointed
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am really disappointed. I have had 4 pairs of X Ultras in the past and can't fault them. Having quite a broad forefoot, I decided to try a pair of the wide fit. The uppers seem to be made of a different material which is not very flexible. As a result, a fold developed after a couple of outings which dug into the lateral part of the upper foot in the region of the metatarsal heads. I have persevered for 6 months in the expectation that things will soften up but, if anything, the shoes have become more painful to the point where I cannot wear them. I would not recommend them.
review.name: Very uncomfortable
comment: Thank you very much for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are surprised to hear of this occurrence with the product. We are constantly striving to improve and innovate with our models to acheive maximum comfort, and feedback such as yours is essential to helping us acheive this objective. Your review will be passed to our quality department immediately for review.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: An excellent service from Salomon. A water proof comfortable shoe that is easy to wear with an excellent secure fit. I use on a daily basis on a mix of surfaces. This is my third pair of X ultra 4 gore-tex shoes.
review.name: A great shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Far to narrow. Returned immediately and now waiting 3 weeks for refund.
review.name: Far to narrow!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these shoes awhile back and they are one of the best wide shoes on the market. Comfortable walking and hiking in these for hours. Once you break them in they fell like slippers.
review.name: The best wide shoes on the market!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoe - the extra width makes them perfect.  Flexible and light weight with great support.
review.name: Light weight and very comfortable

name: X Ultra 4 GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Lighter in weight but still solid.  Used on a few multipitch routes and like them. Will be buying more of these to add to my collection.
Not much to say; these are simple yet great lightweight quickdraws for your trad rack.  Wouldn't be my first choice for sport climbing, but could definitely be used if so inclined.
review.name: Excellent Draws

review.reviewBody: Bought these as my main quickdraws over the Miniwire, as they were too small and not ideal for fumbling in gloved situations.  Used these at the crag and in the backcountry.  Trustworthy strength and minimal weight, with a penchant for handling wet winter situations, I fill my rack with these for all types of climbing.
review.name:
Ideal A


Ideal Quickdraws

review.reviewBody: I bought this quickdraw to lighten up my ice climbing rack. Between the light weight ice screws and litewire draws, my kit has been revolutionized. It feels like my ice rack is half of the weight it used to be. The draws are also very easy to clip with gloves on.
review.name: great compliment to the lightweight ice screw

name: LiteWire Quickdraw

description: Buy the Olukai Honu Flip Flop - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Honu Flip Flop - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Olukai Honu Flip Flop - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are honestly the most fabulous flip-flops. The look is sleek leather. I did not expect them to be nearly as comfortable as they are. I’ve heard great things about the Olukai brand and am happy to have finally tried Them for myself!
review.name: So cute. So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was sent a pair of OluKai - Honu sandals by the TryIt Sampling Community to use and review. I'm always weary about buying new brands of summer footwear. Sometimes the quality just isn't good, the materials don't last long, or they just basically fall apart soon after purchase. Well I'm happy to report that these sandals are great! Well constructed, high quality sandals that form to your feet well and provide support that others just don't provide. They are very comfortable and even have a cute design sketched into the material. I really love this product and recommend it highly.
review.name: Great quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The OluKai - Honu Sandels are very stylish and seem well made.  I love the turtle designs etched into them. They tan color will match with any style.  The only downfall for me is that the rubber soles seem a little heavy. I'm used to foam type soles that are lightweight.  Perhaps that will chang over time.
review.name: Stylish and well made!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These sandals are the cutest! I was a little worried that they were going to be uncomfortable because of the leather straps and such, but they are actually very nice! The design on the are absolutely breathtaking! I almost don't ever want to wear them cause I dont know if it will eventually wear off, but that's a chance I'll take, haha! These provide nice support and have some nice cushion to them! I would go a half size or a size up though, personally. That way you have a little more wiggle room. But, that may just be a personal preference. They are pretty well true to size though! All in all, very cute and comfy!
review.name: I would go...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The OluKai Honu flip flops are so comfortable and I love them. I have a high arch and they provide good arch support for me, they are made of soft leather and fit perfect. When I wear them, I get a lot of compliments on how nice they look. I live in Florida and I wear flip flops year around.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Honu sandal is super cute, super comfy and very stylish. You could wear them with literally anything and it will look perfect. The laser-etched artwork of the sea turtle is stellar and really pulls that Hawaiian beachy feel in to you. It has a wrapped leather footbed and leather straps. Though I will say even though they are super comfy, I wish the little section between your toes was padded just a hair more but I have super sensitive skin. It does not stop me from wearing them though. I do love them! And I have already gotten compliments on them. 

I received a size 9 and I am an 8.5 and they fit me perfectly so if you are a half size, you are fine ordering the whole size 9. Don't go down. Definitely go up the half size.
review.name: Super cute sandals!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these sandals. Very comfortable and stylish. I live the sea turtles design on it and the color goes with anything. They fit perfectly and I get so many compliments on this sandal. They are one of a kind.
review.name: Sandals

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes have exceeded my expectations!  They are very comfortable and stylist.  I am looking forward to wearing them this Summer .  I have already had several compliments on them each time I wear them.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these sandals! I can’t brag enough on the absolute comfort and wearability of my new Olukai Honu Sandals!! They not only are the perfect fit, they feel great, and what’s not to love about something from paradise?!! They are so stylish and I feel great wearing them with my jeans, as well as my sundress. These are comfortable for all day wear and I didn’t have to size up . Perfect fit!
review.name: My absolute favorite!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I gifted these sandals to my mother. She is in her 60s and she loves these sandals for it’s comfortability. The material used to make the sandals seem extremely durable. We also love the color! She is so excited to wear it this summer.
review.name: Comfy

name: Honu Flip Flop - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these as a gift for my dad, whose old slippers were falling apart. He practically lives in them at home now and uses them to get the mail, check on the grill outside, and run out to the garage. I was back and forth between a 40.0 and a 41.0, because he generally wears an 8 in his running shoes but I went with a 40 and that seemed like the right call. According to him, they are "warm and well made"
review.name: Dad's new favorite shoe

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love the Glerups. If you're looking for the absolute softest slippers, you may want to look for something with a fluffy interior, BUT for wool slippers, they're exactly what I expected in softness. They fit and form well to my feet, the rubber bottoms are great to wear outside, they're both incredibly warm but breathable.

NOTE - I ordered a size smaller than I normally do as I wear them without socks and that was the correct sizing.
review.name: Love My Glerups

review.reviewBody: I was expecting a lot more from these.  My husband has the leather bottomed ones and he loves them.  These feel like there's an overly shaped bottom that made me feel like I was walking on a deflated but rounded ball. I think it's just their version of a foot mold and it doesn't work with my foot. I currently have a pair of fleece lined slippers with leather outside material, and I find them to be way warmed.  I was surprised that these didn't feel very warm compared to my current slippers, despite having socks on with them. I'm returning.
review.name: Ehhh.

review.reviewBody: Honestly, I expected more from all the hype. I wore around the house for a day intermittently but they never felt truly comfortable. The left foot felt like I was walking on something strange. I did not feel that way on the right foot so maybe there was a slight defect in the sole even though there was nothing obvious. They also felt itchy if I tried to wear them without socks. I may have kept them, but for the price I expected more.
review.name: Just ok

review.reviewBody: These feel great on my feet right out of the box. I wear a 10 and the 41 fits fine. I got the charcoal/tan combo. I'm wearing them without socks. I was looking for a house-shoe type thing I can work from home in. I have spent time living in Europe, and the europeans are all about these boiled-wool type of house shoes. I am ok spending more up front for products that last. After reading all the great glerups reviews, I decided to try these. They are living up to the hype! And I love how they have a rubber sole so I can take out the trash, call in the cat etc.
review.name: The hype is true

review.reviewBody: I bought them as a XMAS gift. We had to return two other brands because he didn't like them, but when these came they were perfect. He wears them every single day, and goes on and on about how comfortable they are. I highly recommend if you're looking for a great slipper with a nice, sturdy bottom.
review.name: My husband absolutely loves these!

review.reviewBody:
There was an initial hiccup when my first pair of this shoe style quickly developed wool 'blisters' on the top of the shoe- not on pressure points. There were odd dimples that were evident from the start but I didn't pay much attention until the dimples started peeling like blisters and I could see the thin layers of wool separating.

We were inside of 30 days so the return process was fairly simple. They process exchanges like returns so you will need to pay for the new ones before you get a refund on the exchange. There was also a small fee that was deducted from my refund and I'm not sure what that was. Most likely shipping? But it was only 6.99 and I received the new pair with 2-day shipping at no extra charge.

Backcountry processed my refund within 2 days of receiving the defective shoes.

The new pair are perfect!  No dimples. No blisters. I love these shoes!  I wear a women's US 9.5W shoe and the 40.0 fits perfectly with a Smartwool sock and a little loose with no socks  (the slip on style fits the same).

The felt is thick so there isn't much give but they do open up a smidgen around the ankle after a few days of constant wear.
review.name: Easy exchange- 2nd pair of Glerups!

name: The Shoe Rubber Slipper

hasVariant.name: Ultratrail FX One Trekking Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Ultratrail FX One Trekking Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased for the Mammoth Trail Fest 50k.  I have never used poles on a race but due to some of the climbs I thought I would give them a shot.  Very useful on the medium and tough climbs and descents.  Literally practiced twice before the race and was worried if they would be a pain to pull from the quiver and assemble while in motion.  Very easy and seamless.  They were there when I needed them and back in the quiver when I was done.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I've never used running poles before, but these were awesome on a multi-day running trip in the Dolomites. The quick release harness is so handy compared to having to navigate traditional straps. Now I just leave them in my quiver for any big long runs in the Rockies.
review.name: Better and Easier than Anticipated

review.reviewBody: Best Running and Hiking pole I’ve ever used. Poles helped me increase my speed.
review.name: Telluride’s best friend

review.reviewBody: Worth it!  I have been on the fence about running poles and finally decided to give them a try.  These are a breeze.  Light, easy to put together and pull apart, the only part I don't love is the button to push down on to disengage the hand straps.  On the other hand, I won't be losing them over a cliff by accidentally letting go.  They have made a huge difference in my uphill running game, cutting down on ascent time on steep technical grades.
review.name: Worth It!

review.reviewBody: Happy with the poles. They feel sturdy and supportive. Wasn’t sure if I would like the shark grip or not because I have issues with both thumbs and so far they have adjusted well.
review.name: Light as a feather, strong as a bull

review.reviewBody: Build quality is obviously fantastic. Love the gloves. Only thing is that occasionally it's kind of tough to unclip the gloves from the poles like they get jammed in a bit. But overall so pleased.
review.name: Thousand times better than Black Diamond

review.reviewBody: Amazing piece of equipment. Light, fast, cheap. Pick 2!!
review.name: Game changer.

review.reviewBody: It's a great pole! Super light and the Trail Shark system is pretty amazing. You have to try it to understand it. The poles are not the lightest in the Leki lineup but you wouldn't know it unless comparing side by side. These are very light and a great weight/strength compromise, especially if you're a bit taller or heavier. I like the extended grip on these poles too. It effectively makes the pole shorter for steep ascents. The only thing I'd like to see is an easier way to collapse the pole. The current system of the pin is fine but not the easiest. It can be a little difficult to locate on the move and you need to pull the pole section out slightly in order to press the pin. It's made for that, I'm sure, but I would like to see some change to the mechanism here. I got the pink because that's the color they had in 130cm and I needed it when I needed it, but despite being pretty loud, it's actually very cool. Still, I'd love to see some blue in the lineup.
review.name: Super Versatile, Great System

review.reviewBody: Great poles for steep trail running. Lightweight but feel sturdy during use. The grips take some getting used to but they work well, allow you to not have to grip with your hands much. Leki makes 135 mm which can be hard to find from other companies. I'm about 6 feet tall and I think 135 mm are perfect.
review.name: Light but sturdy

review.reviewBody: Compared to my old black diamond poles, I love that these lock into place and connect to the hand straps.  The extra length really helped me climb out of the Grand Canyon with less stress on my legs.
review.name: Great product

name: Ultratrail FX One Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Evie boot is so very nice looking. Not bulky and so comfortable!
review.name: Must have boot!

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for. Comfortable and stylish
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: Really nice mix of practicality (waterproof!) & a bit dressy. They are great with jeans, but also pretty enough to wear with casual dresses. Love the fit & look!
review.name: Elegant & functional

review.reviewBody:
Love them, they were more instantly comfortable than I had anticipated.
Wish you'd bring the woolen duck boots back though.
review.name: EVIE™ II Women's Chelsea

review.reviewBody: LOVE it. It is so comfortable. The seem across the toe did a rub a sore spot on my toe, but a thicker sock solved the issue.
review.name: A MUST PURCHASE

review.reviewBody: These are replacements for my suede boots of the same style. I have 3 pairs of these and would have 4 if the caramel were available in my size. I don't buy a ton of shoes so this says it all- 3 pairs
review.name: Love love love these boots

review.reviewBody: These are perfect boots. I sized up to a half because I figured I'd wear bulky socks for winter, so glad that I did!! Boots are kinda narrow if you have a wide foot.
review.name: Super stylish winter boot!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, cute, just the right heel height. Easy to slip on  and off
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Finally a pair of boots that fit and are comfortable to wear with lightweight socks all day long!  I have narrow heels and most boots allow my heel to move up and down as I walk and would cause blisters if I wore them for long.  These boots hold my foot without feeling tight.  Also the toe fits well and the grey color I purchased looks great!
review.name: Happy Feet

review.reviewBody: Very casual but can also dress up an outfit. You can stand forever without your feet hurting.
review.name: Love these

name: Evie II Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Short Finger Glove
review.reviewBody:
Gloves, like shoes, are highly personal. These didn't work well for me. There's a seam right where I subconsciously rest my thumb on the hoods. After about 30 miles my thumb has a blister and is in immense pain.

So, quality seems great, they're breathable and comfortable aside from this issue. To my hands, the Specialized BG Grail work much better.
review.name: Don't work for me

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Short Finger Glove
review.reviewBody:
I bought these simply to replace older pairs of POC gloves and various other brands, that have reached the end of their life. However after my first ride on these I realized I was missing out on a much better glove. They truly surprised me with the excellent fit and comfort while on the bars. These gloves completely mitigate the bulky seams, and extra fabric that wiggles around loosely on the palm for me, and have a second skin type of feel.

I would not say these run small, however they do run very slim fitting, again like a second layer of skin, so if you are on the line between sizes go up.

I plan on using these for every type of discipline of cycling, I find them to work well for everything in between bombing down black diamond jump lines as well as grinding up steep road climbs.
review.name: New favorite gloves

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Short Finger Glove
review.reviewBody:
Bought them in black, fit is standard for specialized gloves. I wear an XL in them but a M in PI and a L in Giro. 

They're comfortable, I don't particularly notice them while riding. Also they seem to be holding up well in the Florida heat where I dump sweat on them for hours. Padding is good but they aren't bulky.

I don't care for the white specialized tabs on the outside seams but those could be cut off, overall I have zero complaints.
review.name: Solid gloves

name: Body Geometry Sport Gel Short Finger Glove

description: Buy the 22 Designs Outlaw X Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Outlaw X Binding - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the 22 Designs Outlaw X Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fyi, I telemark. This binding is the best one out there for every day skiing. I love the he flex when combined with the tx pro.
review.name: I love this binding

review.reviewBody:
the so called spontaneous pre-release almost led to a serious injury for me, a 800 ft tamahawk down a 45 degree slope over rocks and cliffs in the sidecountry of jackson hole. Ive had 2 pairs of these bindings and the same failures keep happening. The NTN second heel assembly fails every time. 22 Designs wont stand behind there product, they want me to beat on the binding with a hammer to fix it. They know about these failures and are doing nothing to rectify it. if you get hurt on this binding lawyer up. DON'T BUY THIS BINDING YOUR LIFE DEPENDS ON IT

22D has been a good manufacture of 75mm bindings but it seems like they came out with the outlaw to fast.
review.name: THIS BINDING IS UNSAFE

name: Outlaw X Binding - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These shoes are great for riding, love that they stay solid on my pedals, no slippages and comfortable to walk/wear when you’re not riding.
 I had to order a 1/2 size smaller, I felt that the fit a bit big for me. 
I would still highly recommend!!
review.name: Love them!

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Super pour le vélo de montagne 
Confortable et grandeur habituelle
review.name: Good montain bike shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good for mountain biking, fit on the larger size, I wear women’s running shoes 7.5, went down to 6.5 for these.
review.name: Go down one size

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome and stylish shoes that I was stoked to get!
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Look great, and feel okay. Shoes are still slightly narrow, even though I always have to get a 1/2 size up with Adidas. The price definitely made the purchase worth it!
review.name: Great look, great price!

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I am typically a 5.5 (european 36). I ordered the 5.5 and the box said a european 36 2/3. This is definitely at least 1 inch bigger than any of my other 5.5/36 shoes. 

A friend who is typically a size 7.5 tried them on as well, for fit - and said they were a little snug. We think the 5.5 might actually be between a 6.5 and a 7. 

Buyer beware - maybe try on before you buy.
review.name: Sizing Issues

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought to ‘upgrade’ my husband’s wardrobe. AlwYs played it safe until I bought these for him. He loves them
review.name: These are stylish and a bit different - just right

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’d recommend it not just to cyclists but to everyone
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Great shoe, stick to pedal like no tomorrow!

Size is a little small but so long as you know that when you buy it is not a problem
review.name: I will buy again!

name: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Cross Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Swix Cross Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm getting great use from these as a winter hike pant. I look forward to XC and snowshoeing with them. The bottom of the leg is trim and won't get caught on micro spikes and the length is perfect. They are warm enough but don't get you overheated, and allow you freedom of movement. The inside is a nice brushed fabric. Love the stretch waist band-- perfect for layering over. Be warned-- this XS is smaller than the XXSs out there, no size inflation here! it's a close to body fit.
review.name: A great pant, true XS

review.reviewBody: The Large was too tight so I had to order the Extra Large. I wore these skinning up a mountain in 20 degree weather and they were comfortable. The fabric feels very durable but stretchy.
review.name: Athletic Fit

name: Cross Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I own 2 of the Backcountry brand duffles and 1 North Face Base Camp duffle. Very comparable duffles, but I absolutely prefer the Backcountry. Zippers on the Backcountry are so much nicer than North Face. Both bags are waterproof, but the material on the Backcountry is much more flexible and better for packing, unpacking and digging through
review.name: Prefer over North Face

review.reviewBody: Durable construction. Not lightweight. I like the separate compartment for dirty/wet clothes or shoes on one side and there's enough pockets to keep small things organized. Not your typical nylon fabric- expect this to hold up well. I'm using for DH MTB helmet and pads, etc. and its plenty big enough.
review.name: Burly duffel bag

review.reviewBody: Seems durable enough so far and I really like the smaller pockets in the top flap for organizing smaller items that usually float around in large duffle bags.  Most likely will buy another one!
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: The size is good and fits things well with multiply compartments but when you go to travel with these back country duffels don’t wear them on your back the straps tear into your shoulders
review.name: Don’t use the straps for a backpack

review.reviewBody: These bags were great for our road trip across the middle states and in and out of national parks! Super impressed with the room available and pack ability into the car. I liked these bags better than the Patagonia one I have of the same size! My kids kept all their stuff in one place and could carry them in and out of hotels like a backpack! Perfect!
review.name: Excellent product!

review.reviewBody: I had the Patagonia black hole duffel for over 10 years and loved it. It held up for every single trip I ever went on. Great for a weekend but also would use it internationally for weeks. The backcountry bag looked like it would be a better version of the patagonia due to some key features. I really like the large separate end pocket for dirty clothes or shoes. The cinch straps on the sides also work really well. Even with these nice features there are a couple reasons why I'd choose to stay with my old trusty patagonia. The backpack straps on this bag are awful. The top are adjustable but they just end up loosening as you wear and become very uncomfortable. The durability of this bag seems majorly lacking too. My old bag lasted me over 10 years and still usable it just looks a little grungy. This backcountry bag had issues after the second use. The mesh pocket on the inside of the flap is already coming apart at the seam. Not sure if I just happened to get a manufacturing defect on that or what but not impressed. Was really hopeful for this bag but it just missed the mark for me.
review.name: Almost as Good as Patagonia

review.reviewBody: New goto for my riding (MTB) gear or travel duffel for a long weekend. Sizable duffel that can handle all of my mtn bike gear. Thick material looks to be extremely durable, and the detachable backpack straps are a huge bonus. The all black is a Gucci as it gets
review.name: Your new goto duffel

review.reviewBody: Perfect bag for all of my sledding gear,  2 coats, boots, gloves, hats, etc. all in one very durable and good looking bag
review.name: Great bag for Sledding

review.reviewBody: Perfect duffel bags are needed for this dude to hit the mountains 🏔️ each month helping people. I’m a proud owner of epic pagucci (Patagonia black hole 55) it’s 10/10 -but I needed bigger and the backcountry is 4 ⭐️ so far - will know after this trip!
review.name: Gear ready duffel

review.reviewBody: These bags are so well made. Sturdier than a Patagonia Black Hole Duffel. I love all of the pockets. The loops are great for clipping gear on. The colors are great! This is my second one. I bought my first for ski boots and gear. This one I use for travel. It’s perfect for a week long trip.
review.name: Better than a Black Hole Bag!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's such a great addition to the tent for storage space. The only downside is that the weight obviously causes the top of the tent to collapse a bit.
review.name: Great add-on

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice way to put clothing or items to keep them organized and out of the way but still easy to reach when needed.
review.name: Handy shelf to help tent livability

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Adds a nice space for our jackets and other light objects. I feel that it should have been included with the purchase of the tent as most of our other tents came with a gear loft. Definitely like having it.
review.name: Worth having, should have came with the tent.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sea to Summit has become my go to camping gear now. Telos is a great tent and the cargo net works perfectly.
review.name: My favorite gear

review.reviewBody: Love it! Very functional and works nicely with the Telos TR2 - Two Person Freestanding Tent. I stored my clothing in it during a week long trip and it allowed for more floor space. Don't forget to use the tent stuff sacs as tiny storage containers. They work nicely too.
review.name: Telos™ Gear Loft

review.reviewBody: Took some fumbling to figure out which it way it went up. My first trip out it didn’t seem to fit at all, but the weather turned unexpectedly cold so I didn’t play with it very much. One the second trip, I got it figured out. It stays in place well, holds clothing and gear seemingly without issue, allows me to spread things out to dry and packs up in place when you take the tent down. Glad I purchased it!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: You've already invested a good amount into a tent... don't stop now! Seriously...this this is a amazing, keeps all of your sleeping clothing up and off the floor.
review.name: Must buy

review.reviewBody: I had my Telos for a whole year before investing in the gear loft. Oops. It's so nice to be able to stow clothes off the tent floor.
review.name: Wish I Bought It Sooner

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The gear loft is an awesome addition. It’s roomy and can support some heavy wet clothing. It’s weight adds a couple of ounces but it increased area to store and dry clothing is worth it. Definitely worth it.
review.name: Really keeps gear high and dry!

review.reviewBody: I am very pleased with this gear loft shelf. It really utilizes the great headspace in the Telos tent. It’s wonderful for keeping the floor of the tent decluttered.
review.name: Perfect addition to an awesome tent

name: Gear Loft
